title: Better buy in person
text:
I like my experience from buying on Amazon most of the time, but unfortunately not this time because I got a faulty dragon. The right wing stuck to the neck gill, and the left wing tip was so bendy that it curled up into a spiral. Took a lot of time and effort to fix that bend. Would be better if you just go to a local store to buy these, so you can inspect the thing in person and you won't get a faulty one.
Otherwise, details are good, fun to paint.
This specific dragon doesn't have a good base though, not stable enough.

title: good gun, but too many cons
text:
I am nearly 14 years old and i've had my share of nerf wars, and trust me, only use the longshot when you have somewhere to duck behind to reload, or have a full clip. The best case scenario for reloading is having a full clip ready to pop in. But when you're not that lucky, you have to load up the clip (which takes awhile,) and then pop it in. That is where it is worse than the firefly, and maverick. It does shoot streamline darts pretty far (over the advertised 30 ft.) but those are the only darts it uses, and the streamline hurt even more in the maverick. The gun also jams a lot. You'll be shooting, you'll reload, push up the bolt, but then it won't click in. Eventually you realize there is already a dart stuck in there somehow. Luckily, NERF addressed this problem and put in a jam door under the tactical rail(handle). But the darts get pretty beat, and it's hard to find refills for the list price. The "scope' is pretty pathetic, so you should just take that off because if somthings lined up perfectly in it, the dart's bound to go a foot below. The pistol extension is good for sniping, as is the fold-down bipod, but gets in the way otherwise. It is cool to shoot two darts at once, though.
Now, finally the good things. This gun is probably the easiest to keep firing within a clip of the ones i've used (i have yet to try the recon cs-6), and is the most accurate. Or, you could hold it like a shotgun and just fire away. And because it is very big (too big with the extension) it is good to shield yourself with. And if you don't have a clip ready, you can slide the dart down the barrel and then cock the gun, although it isn't recommended. So this is a great gun, but i'm not sure if i'd suggest this over the firefly.

title: Awesome shipping time and amazing quality!!!
text: Oh man, I have been trying to get this statue for about 4 months! Wish I would have found this seller first. Ordered from them and had it at my house within a week (and that includes holiday times which makes shipments wonky). The box was a little banged up but everything inside was perfect! Easy to put together (goggles, head, gun, and stand all separate from the main body, but all have designated clip areas to make sure you have everything fit just right) and the color and craftsmanship are stunning! I love my bad ass Bulma!

title: Prudes beware! This game is not for you.
text: We have family game nights now and then with two grown sons and girlfriends. This game is a blast. Easy to figure out the rules, then jump in with your best descriptions and pantomimes.

title: Buyer Beware!
text: The headline of the product says 1000 pieces jigsaw puzzle. But when you get down to the small print, there are only 200+ pieces and the puzzle measures 6" x 4". The puzzle comes in a container the size of a cigar tube, and each piece is about the size of your pinkie fingernail. This is a double scam because Amazon doesn't want to have anything to do with this third-party seller so you must deal directly with the Chinese company. And of course, if you want to return the item for a refund, you're paying to send it back to China.

title: Unique set!
text: I ordered this for my youngest and she's really enjoying it a lot. Unlike other stacking box sets we've had, the windows or doors the store the animals in is really cute. She definitely enjoys these stackers over others because of that. But unfortunately having a cutout also makes them less stable. The cardboard or paper board these boxes are made of are not as strong as other brands we've had either. They've gotten quite beat up already and don't stack anywhere near as well as one new; after a month of being played with. We've had other sets that have made it through several children but unfortunately this set appears it isn't going to make it even a couple months.

title: Super cute!
text: I ordered these for my daughter to hand out at school and she is really happy that I did. The little rubber squishies that come along with the cards are all the rage at her school, so she can't wait to give them to her friends. Plus I like that we're giving out a treat that isn't candy. We're both impressed with this set, so I would have to recommend them!

title: So much fun!!!
text:
We've found that these Angry bird plushes are great for kids of every age! I've seen all of my kids, (ages 8-13yo) playing with him. They are recreating the Angry Birds game right here in our hallway nearly every day since they got him.
But this one in particular is super cute, because he is huge! In person, this plush feels very well made. The material is really thick and dense. It doesn't feel like that inexpensive, "carnival- prize" like fabric. He is super soft and squeezable; yet this bird came stuffed solid with filling too.
As the mom, I especially appreciate that the eyes are designed out of thread. And not the hard plastic eyeballs most plushes have. The threaded eye design make these birds a lot "safer" to throw! I don't have to worry about someone getting hurt or my kids breaking something real with this guy! He's been a ton of fun, so we would all recommend him.

title: Very nice quality!
text:
In person, this plush is really nice! He is super cute and and feels very well made. I especially appreciate that the eyes are designed out of thread... as opposed to the hard plastic eyes most plushes come with. The sewn-on thread eyes make these birds a lot "safer" to throw! Surprisingly, I don't have to worry about someone getting hurt or my kids breaking something real with these Angry bird plushes!
The material this bird is made out of is very nice as well. It doesn't feel like that inexpensive, thin, "carnival- prize" like fabric. This plush came stuffed solid, yet it is super soft and squeezable. We would have to recommend him because my kids are beyond thrilled. I catch them almost everyday playing with him; recreating the Angry Birds game right here in our own hallway.

title: Bigger than expected!
text:
This Angry Bird plush was a lot nicer in person than I was expecting. He is really colorful and very well made. My favorite part is that the eyes are designed out of thread... as opposed to a hard plastic eyeballs like most plushes have. The fabric eyes makes these guys a lot "safer" to throw across the room! Surprisingly, I don't have to worry about someone getting hurt or something breaking with these Angry bird plushes!
The material this bird is made out of is very nice too; it doesn't feel like an inexpensive carnival prize type fabric. This plush is filled solid, yet is super soft and squeezable. My kids are beyond thrilled with this line of birds. Nearly everyday they play with them (nicely!!!) recreating the Angry Birds game in our hallway.

title: Very nice set!
text: My 9yo is a huge Minecraft fan, so she is beyond thrilled to be handing these Valentines day "treats" out. And I like that we're not handing out more candy! Up close, these keychains are not the best quaintly, but they'll do fine for a inexpensive holiday trinket. Also know the cards are not as big as the third picture (with the hand) makes them appear. She is happy with them, so we would have to recommend them!

title: Better than a candy treat!
text: This is a really cute set of Valentines day cards! My daughter is really artsy, so she is beyond thrilled to give out these unique colored pencils to her classmates. Plus, I like that these cards come with a treat that will last.... it feels better than giving out more sugar. It's a nice, high quality set. We both would recommend them.

title: Didn't know how much we needed this until it came
text:
My daughter's collection of Minibrands and World's Smallest is ironically getting bigger all the time. They would go missing or fall behind something on her shelf, which renders them totally useless. This case has been a miracle, if nothing else for keeping everything in one place.
It is sturdy with good construction, and easy for our middle schooler to get in and out of.
Now she can display her ever-growing collection and have easy access!

title: Absolutely fantastic!
text: My kids were beyond thrilled when I pulled this out of the Amazon box. We have a house full of creative artists, and all of them have enjoyed using this new Mandala maker. My youngest especially likes that it can travel with her in the car or on overnight trips to grandma's house. This set seems well made too and the plastic is thick enough. I'd expect it to last.

title: Too cute!
text: These Christmas themed bubbles are super unique and tons of fun! I broke them out at our first holiday Christmas party and the kids had a blast. They arrived safely. Definitely recommended by everyone. These would make a great add on gift or stocking stuffer too.

title: Love that it's fabric!!!
text: My daughter is beyond thrilled with her new doll bike seat carrier. We found out quickly that it fits teddy bears and other stuff plushes too! This carrier feels really well made and was super easy to put on her bike. She thinks taking some of her favorite toys along on a bike is really neat. I also love that it is made of fabric. Probably not advised, but this is something that I would totally throw this in the washing machine!

title: Simply too adorable!
text:
The moment I pulled this egg out of the Amazon box, my youngest was beyond thrilled! The plush is really cute and all of the pieces were easy enough for her to open independently. This egg in particular seemed more "fun" to open, since it came with lots of sealed mini eggs included. And she was quite excited by all the little trinkets she received.
But once all the pieces were opened, I wasn't impressed. The toys feel inexpensive and are quite small. Besides, things like slime and stickers are NOT unique. And there was so much waste. I felt terrible throwing away so much wasted plastic. So I had to remind myself it is about the experience for the kids, and not so much about what was included inside. It really was a fun treat for our daughter, after all. She would certainly recommend this egg!

title: Absolutely adorable!
text:
This Little People ET Mash-up is one of the cutest things we've seen yet. My husband is an 80's geek and even took this set to display on his desk at work, lol. He says they get all the attention! Nearly everyone has to stop and touch them.
This set would make a truly adorable and unique gift for any fan! And true to Fisher Price's history, these Little People came package great and the figures are well made. We can't recommend this set enough!

title: Simply adorable!
text: This Little People Mash-up is one of the cutest things we've seen yet. This set would make a truly adorable and unique gift for any fan! True to Fisher Price's history, these Little People came package perfectly and the figures are well made. Can't recommend this set enough!

title: Absolutely adorable!
text: My kids are huge Sonic fans, but finding non-clothing merch has been a chore! These little guys are exactly what my kids were looking for. They're fun, cute and unique. The figures are not traditionally Lego Mini-figure sized, but we think that is ideal. My husband was (very) happy to find that if any of these Sonic pieces ended up mixed in with the kid's real Legos in the future, they'd be easy to identify. The quality of these figures isn't the greatest; but the kids really haven't noticed, nor would they care if they did. All four of my kids love these dudes.

title: Fantastic binder!!
text: My kids have more Pokemon cards that storage space for them. We are always in need of binders. I ordered this one in particular because of the bright red color. I want to keep their more valuable cards separate from their normal collection. This is a nicely constructed binder of faux leather with stitching along the border. It feels well made and like it should last a long time. The binder also arrived quick and safe.

title: Absolutely adorable!
text:
I ordered this set for my youngest, because he is a huge Octonauts fan -and- he loves playing card games with the family. So this was the perfect mash-up for him. And from the moment I pulled it out of the Amazon bag, he was beyond thrilled.
It's a nice set too and he likes playing all three games. The cards are made from a sturdy card stock and I expect them to last. This set was an excellent find. It would make the perfect stocking stuffer or add-on gift for any younger child.

title: Super cute
text: I ordered this yo-yo for my youngest, because she is a huge Miraculous fan. And she was beyond thrilled when I pulled this gadget out of the Amazon bag. It's made out of plastic, but doesn't feel too cheap or inexpensive. She's had a lot of fun playing with this yo-yo. It would make an adorable "add-on" gift or stocking stuffer!

title: Really cute!
text: I ordered this for my youngest because she is a true artist at heart -and- she loves the original Spirograph kit. So she was beyond thrilled when I pulled this out of the bag... and can't believe she can take it with her. This would make an adorable "add-on" gift or a stocking stuffer. She's happy, so I would have to recommend it.

title: Cuter than expected!
text: Sonic is really "in" right now, so my daughter was beyond thrilled when I pulled this keychain out of the bag. She put it on her backpack immediately! He was slightly bigger than expected and seems like nice quality. She was extra geeked out because this one lights up. We would both have to recommend it, for sure!

title: Ok quality
text: The wood blocks we received had quite a few missing paint chips on each square. And these blocks were smaller than the ones I've seen in the past. Since the quality isn't there, I don't think I would reorder them again.

title: Absolutely fantastic!
text: I ordered this for my youngest to hand them out to him as a reward, and we're both really happy that I did. I know they're not the traditional decks, but he is every bit as thrilled with them as the originals. They're well made but affordable... so neither of us have to feel bad if he looses one at school. These were a fun and cool find; and I will happily be buying him the other eraser set for xmas.

title: Kids love it!
text: Our kids think this version is even more fun than the original! They played for over an hour with their best friends, laughing the entire time. The concept is easy, but the game is challenging enough to keep them interested. Plus I like that it got them up and moving (not just sitting around playing another game). And while on the surface, this game might only seem "fun"; it is also improving their dexterity and hand/eye coordination skills. We would all recommend it!

title: Excellent quality!
text: I can't wait to dress our elf up as Santa! I'm certain the kids will get a huge kick out of it. The costume is well made and fits our elf doll well. Highly recommended!

title: Absolutely fantastic!
text: Too cute and the pieces fit our doll well! I can't wait to make up pirate scavenger hunt!!! I suspect this will be one of their most remembered days with their elf yet.

title: Cute, but easy game
text: I picked this up for long car rides, since we live in northern Wisconsin and often find ourselves without service. This has been a fun addition, and a good game for a variety of ages... but especially for 8-11 yo. It's an interesting puzzle game that has helped entertain our kids for several hours already.

title: Cute collectable!
text: Probably much like yours, we have multiple Minecraft fans in this household... so they were beyond thrilled when I pulled these ducks out of the box! All three ducks work like real rubber ducks in the bath tub too!!! They're made of a thick, durable plastic. So this unique set would be great for play. But also, just as adorable on display! My kids would highly recommend this mash-up.

title: Beyond adorable!
text:
I ordered this raincoat for my youngest Frozen fan and I am so thrilled that I did! It is even more adorable in person! But I also think the colors look very close to the manufacture's pictures.
From the moment I touched this raincoat, I could tell it was really high quality. The outer vinyl material is thick but flexible; and the inside lining is super soft. Because of the lining, I would consider it a "warmer" rain jacket... which is perfect for us up here in northern Wisconsin. She could easily wear it in the fall, early winter and again in the spring. Besides, this coat fits her perfectly too.... yet it still has room to grow. We both absolutely love it. I couldn't find one bad thing to write about it. It's truly lovely.

title: They were thrilled!
text: From the moment I pulled this out of the box, my kids were beyond thrilled! They had seen it on youtube and knew exactly what it was and how it worked. So of course it was an immediate hit. They love to show it off anytime friends come over. Which is the reason I took away one star, was because it only gets used now to "show off". Just like actual pokie cards, the thrill wore off as quick as opened. The good news is it feels well made. It works and doesn't glitch out. And it is great for any age (grown men included, lol), though it was our 7 & 9yo who like it the most.

title: Nice quality!
text: We're huge monopoly fans, so I was beyond thrilled to order these stickers! They arrived safe in a thick cardboard envelope. The colors are bold and bright; and the printing quality is top notch. I initially wanted to put a few small stickers on my car ... But now I want to put them everywhere! And I'm a grown woman, lol. I absolutely love them. I smile every time I see one!

title: Absolutely wonderful!
text: I ordered this for my 9yo and she is beyond thrilled that I did! It has been a huge hit!!! The board is nice and sturdy... and it makes weaving a bracelet far easier than I remember it being when I was a kid! And she doesn't need any help from an adult, so yay for that! The only thing was, she blew through the yarn that came with this kit really quick. It says there is enough for 8 bracelets included, but I'm pretty sure she only made 6 before and it was all gone by the end of the weekend. I guess that only goes to show just how much she loved it. I will happily buy her the inexpensive refill string to keep her happy and busy! This was an excellent find and truly would make a great gift.

title: Great for the car
text: We live in Northern Wisconsin, where cell reception is very spotty. So we've always keep electronic games in the car to help pass the time. And this game has been a huge winner! My kids love the two player mode and I love that this game has a mute button!!! The game concept itself isn't all that unique (it reminds me of the vintage electronic Simon game), but at this one is more fun. I find myself thinking about it hours afterward and wanting to go back and play more. It's a lot of fun so we and everyone in our family would recommend it!

title: Kids love them!
text: I ordered this fidget set for my kids and they are really happy that I did! Most of the pieces we got seem like nice quality and have been holding up well. Plus I love that you get a ton of items in this box... it's kept my kids from fighting over individual pieces, lol. The only bad thing I could think to write about this set so far is the stretchy noodles were kind of small. But overall, this fidget set was a really neat find!

title: So much fun!
text: We try to have family board game night at least once a week, so Disney Sorcerer's Arena was a welcome addition to our collection! It really has been a ton of fun too!!! We've played it three times so far and there is no indication that it will get old any time soon. It truly is fun for the whole family and we would HIGHLY recommend it!!!

title: Now this is a cool set
text:
From the moment my kids saw this box, they were beyond thrilled. They love to dress up so everyone it perfect for them.
The helmet fits everyone in my family and seems to be made out of durable plastic. They fight over Buzz's pieces all the time. I would definitely say it was a huge winner. The set would make a fantastic gift for any Toy Story fan!

title: These sticky hands work as advertise
text:
I ordered these sticky hands as a NON-CANDY option to hand out this Halloween... and then my kids found them. They happily opened and played with two dozen before I noticed. So I'll have to order more, lol.
But at least I can report that these guys are consistently sticky. But know they are smaller. About half the size of the ones we have had in the past. But considering sticky hands generally last about 10 minutes before they get to dirty to use (no matter the size), this set will work just fine! We're happy with them.

title: So much fun!
text: Our daughter absolutely loves this new musical piano. From the moment I pulled it out of the box, she has played with it daily. Probably three or four times a day if I'm being honest. And just like you'd expect from Playskool, this toy is really well made. It would make an excellent birthday or holiday gift, for sure!

title: So much fun!
text: I ordered these as a reward gift for my 3rd and 5th grader and they absolutely love them. These fidgets keep their hands busy while lounging around... which keeps them from getting in trouble. I also like how these octopus came individually wrapped. They easily could be stocking stuffers or apart of a children's gift bag. My kids would highly recommend them!

title: Not a fan of the partial non-washable marker set
text:
The markers quality is nice. And they are a juicy, highly pigmented set of children's markers.
But I don't understand why the manufacture would make a set that comes with only 85% washable markers for little kids. Don't get me wrong; neon markers are awesome! But Crayola has been making washable neon markers for several decades already.
Besides, I think this set is expensive at the current price listed ($19.99). You can get twice as many Crayola markers for this same price here on Amazon.... and Crayola is made in the USA! As a frugal parent, I can not recommend the Arteza set.

Hope this review was helpful.

title: The kids love them
text: I ordered these necklaces simply for fun and we are all happy that I did! They are great and decent quality for a temporary decorative piece. The only thing we noticed was the solid pumpkin necklace appears to be made completely different than the other two necklaces. But still, all three seem to work equally as well and my kids are beyond thrilled them. These necklaces were an excellent value and a fantastic find!!!

title: Captured their attention!
text:
This set is adorably cute! It truly is. But it only uses the basic paper airplane shape, in a variety of sizes. My older kids had the Usborne Fold & Fly book several years ago, and I remember liking that one better. That had different types of paper plane shapes... not just different sizes. But still, my younger kids still love this book and don't miss what they didn't know existed. This book has bright colors and the paper is nice quality. At the end of the day, this book is a lot of fun. I would have to recommend it, if you find the price right.
Hoppe this review was helpful.

title: Absolutely too cute!
text: I ordered this for my 6yo and she was super geeked when I pulled this out of the Amazon bag. Plus we have a Husky pup in real life, so she was beyond thrilled with the connection. But a day or two after she opened this surprise set, the excrement seemed to wear off. Especially since the fillers are common penny gifts. The stuff plush is still really cute and one of her favorite stuffed animals still!

title: An excellent addition!
text: This was such a cool find. Probably much like yours, my youngest is fascinated by his wooden train set. And every piece that came in this box is useful. They all feel well made. And they help keep his frustration when building way down. Just that receives a 10/10, for sure!

title: Not as much fun as I'd hoped
text:
This was our first Villanious game, and I was hoping that my family would love it. We love Star Wars and board games. It LOOKS great, and it definitely has the bad-guys feel to it, but we couldn't get into it.
First and most important, we felt like there was just too much reading to get started. My 11 year old got bored and frustrated pretty quick. Being that every character has pretty much their own style, its a lot to get going. I'll probably try it again with adult friends and see how it goes before trying to get my kids to play again.
The board, cards, and tokens have nice look and feel to them. The player figures have odd marbling to them that I didn't particularly like, but they didn't feel cheap.
As others mentioned, the choice of which Villians are included was questionable. I can think of quite a few classic villians that would have been a better choice, but I understand they are trying to keep "current" with the new age of Star Wars in Rebels/Mandolorian, etc.
So far, I feel like this is a miss that could have been super great

title: Absolutely fantastic!
text: We have a house full of Minecraft fans, so this toy was to be shared by all the kids. I see it being played with at least once a day and they all love it. My 8yo says it's the coolest MC toy they have yet. So cool that he and our youngest constantly fight over who gets to keep it in their room. Also know that the dragon is huge.... It was a lot larger than we expected anyway! It seems well made. Everyone here loves it so and we'd all recommended it, for sure.

title: It's ok
text:
This is probably the 8th or 9th electronic book we have around here and I think it is the most "boring" one yet. Our other electronic books are more captivating and toy like. But this one, inherently being a dictionary, is full of words. I know, duh. But the pictures are a little dull too. I suspect this is still one you'll have to sit down and read with your children, in order for them to get the most out of it. I don't think it is captivating enough for my children to pick up and be entertain by independently.
With that said, it is still a product made by V-tech. As expected, the quality of this is exceptional. Vtech has always been worth every penny; so I'm struggling leaving this particular one 4 stars.

title: Fantastic but not enough hangers
text: I ordered this for my youngest daughter and she was thrilled with it. It holds more than we expected it would and feels pretty well made. She said she wished it came with more hangers (especially since she has already lost two). She's happy with it though and I would happily buy this again for a Barbie fan. It added a lot of fun to her dolls.

title: A lot more fun than expected!
text: I ordered this set for my 6yo and I am really happy that I did! From the moment I pulled them out of the amazon box, all of my kids were hooked. They've played with them nearly every day. And they love setting them up and taking turns blasting each other's down. I also think it was a pretty good deal, considering you get 20 guys for $10. My kids have been constantly asking for more, lol.

title: Got for the kids, kept for myself
text:
I normally stay away from off brand building bricks, but this set called to me. I originally got it for the kids, but after they walked away I ended up completing it myself.
Each of the little dino builds are neat and then connect together, Voltron style, to make a big robot.
The brick quality is actually a little better than most knockoffs, and the instructions were easy to follow. All of the pieces were accounted for, with a few extras.
Again, not Lego, but one of the better off brand experiences I have had so far!

title: 3 dino favorites in one set!
text:
For my kids, the minifigures, or the animals in this case, have always been the main draw.
All sets have cute little builds, but what you really want is the figures. For the price, this is the best you will get with Duplo. 3 dinos, a Triceratops, Pteranodon, and Brachiosaurus and a dino doctor lady.
The build is simple, like most Duplos, but overall its a really nice cheap set!
Great birthday/special event gift!

title: Massively huge hit!
text: I ordered this beast to take to our friend's lake house and everyone was so happy that I did. It was the life of the party! It was very well loved by eight (8) pre-teen and teenage kids over the course of a four-day weekend and the dino held up beautifully. I am happy to report that he is made out of some very high quality material! And the raptor is far bigger in person than I was expecting, based off of the photos. The only thing I would recommend is having an electronic pump. If you hand to hand-pump this bad boy up, it would take all day! Anyway, this riding dinosaur was an excellent find. Well worth the $35 it was listed at when I wrote this review! It kept the kids in the water and busy for hours!!!

title: Excellent river raft!
text:
We took this raft to the lake with us last weekend and it held up really well. We had eight (8) pre-teen and teenage kids with us, so this tube was fought over a lot and it really took a beating!
The floaty seems to be made out of high quality materials. It was easy to inflate too and kept its full shape most of the day. After almost eight hours, it had lost a little air... but that was more than acceptable for how much it had been used. Anything that can survive my group, I have to highly recommend.

title: Only lasted about 8 hours
text: I ordered this for our backyard slip-n-slide and I am sorry to say that that id didn't last into all that long into day number two for very long. The first day it held up amazing well for the ton of abuse that it took. Nor am I sure that we used this dragon floaty as intended, lol. It was still beautiful in person and was the absolute highlight of the party. I still would have to recommend it. The dragon was a massive hit, after all.

title: 9 & 10yo (highly) approved!
text: I ordered this for my daughter and it ended up being one of the biggest hits of the summer. Her best friend and her pull out this kit at least twice a week to make bracelets. It's a really easy to use set and comes with more than enough bands to make dozens of bracelets. The girls have made just about everyone they know several "gifts" already. And the girls are so proud of their creations too! So I can't recommend this set enough. I bet it really would make the perfect birthday or holiday present for that beautifully creative child you have in mind.

title: Best add-on piece yet!
text: Our youngest is a huge Thomas fan and plays with his train set constantly. So when I pulled this station out of the Amazon box, he was beyond thrilled. This has become his new favorite accessory piece; and is always at the center of his current set up. The station is high quality and very well made. And while I am certain this piece will retain it's value, my son would tell you this piece is worth it's weight in gold. It was an excellent find and we couldn't be happier with this station playset. I think it would make a memorable gift, for sure.

title: But also order some Crayola Dry Erase CRAYONS
text:
We absolutely adore this book. It's very well made and my daughter it is among my daughter's favorite toys. She pulls it out at least once a day! And it can keep her attention for 20minutes (or more!) at a time, which is very impressive at this age.
The only thing we figured out real quick is the dry erase marker is not washable or stain proof. So luckily, we already had dry erase crayons on hand. They're perfect since they wipe away easier than markers and don't stain a thing!

title: Really cute
text:
Words can't even explain how thrilled my kids were when I pulled this blind bag trio out of the Amazon box. It absolutely was the highlight of their day (and them some days after, lol). A month later, my 9yo daughter still has all three box sets displayed in her room. So my kids would tell you these are worth a million dollars.
And I can't necessary disagree. All of the pieces we received were really cute and seemed really well made too. The quality IS there. But with that said, I usually try not to comment on what is or isn't a good deal here on Amazon. A "good value" is subjective, after all. But personally, I have a really hard time saying I would buy these again. They're cute, but not $40 for a set of three cute.

title: Wonky eye and choppy hair
text: I ordered this doll for my 6yo daughter, and even though she absolutely loves her, the doll we received isn't up the the same quality as other AG's we own. Her hair isn't all one long length; but instead has these weird, uneven chunks in the back. So getting her hair back into the original braid is never going to happen again. Her hair is still a beautiful shade of blue though.

title: You can do better
text: We've had good luck with Swimline products in the past, so I surprised by this one. My hubby said the hoop was terrible and wouldn't stay together. The kids had some fun with the extra games though; and continue to play with them. But at this price point, I think you can find a higher quality set here on Amazon.

title: Beginner "Lego" drone
text:
My kids and I do a LOT of Lego building, so if you are familiar with Lego Technic, this should look very familiar. It is listed as a 5-in-1 set, with 4 other building options than the drone. Honestly, I thought the other 4 builds were fun to do once, but the main draw is certainly the drone.
This was our first drone experiment, and I think it was good for an intro. The app was easy enough to install and use, and it had some fun options. Nothing too complicated, but fun nonetheless.
Keep in mind that this is a small beginner drone, don't expect to go far with it. But my kids had fun, and we didn't have to worry about it breaking because you can just put it back together!
My opinion, the other builds are kind of lame, the drone build was fun, and it is an acceptable intro drone for kids.

title: Really fun!
text: At $2 a piece, these are truly excellent little gifts. My kids have had a blast playing with them. We've had these dinos for a couple of weeks and they're holding up well too. Highly recommended!

title: Must be good!
text: I am rating this product at 5 stars, because the seller sent the product out as promised... it simply never arrived to my house. It looked really neat and like it would have made a fun white elephant gift.

title: More environmentally friendly that water balloons!
text:
I ordered these for our backyard pool and the kids are so happy that I did. They're fun, little water balls that pack a tiny punch. But not in a dangerous way, lol.
They were slightly bigger than I expected and just as colorful as pictured too. They seem to be well made and my kids are having a blast with them. They are demanding that I order more, so I would have to say everyone here recommends them!

title: Beyond adorable!
text:
I ordered this for my 3yo and I am so happy that I did. This electronic patient tablet is shaping up to easy be on of her favorite toys. She loves walking around and diagnosing the rest of us, and then fixing our ailments. All of the accessory pieces are cute and feel well made too. She usually pulls out this kit 2-3 times a day, so I would have to recommend it.
Hope this review was helpful.

title: Backyard fun!
text: This is an excellent outside toy for a wide range of kids.... I know since it huge has been a hit with all of our kids who range in age from 4yo to 13yo! Plus, I think this toy was a really great deal. I normally do not comment on a price of an item, since a good deal can be subjective... but at the $14 price tag for this bubble blower, my kids have gotten their "money's worth" and then some! The only thing is I expect you will want to have extra bubbles on hand though. My kids went through the 4ounce bottle of bubbles included the first day!

title: Huge Hit!!!
text:
Probably like yours, my kids love Among Us... and my 8yo is obsessed. So words can not accurately describe how thrilled my the 8yo was when I pulled this toy out of the Amazon box. We had no idea authentic Among Us toys even existed! Needless to say she was beyond grateful.
The toy plane and little figures seem well made too. The plastic is hard and the pieces all sturdy. It's a very fun and colorful set. She was so happy, that I immediately ordered extra Among Us figures to go with it. I suspect this will be her favorite gift of the year. It was an excellent find!

title: Interesting character choice
text:
My son has several figures from this line, but I think this one was the most unusual choice.
I don't recall seeing the Raid Captain or Ravager in the games, but my son likes it either way.
The biggest draw has been the Ravager, the ridable bull. It fits with the other Minecraft characters as well, so most of the time it has been the transport for Steve and friends instead of the Raid Captain.
This is a nice addition to our ever-growing Minecraft figure collection.
~~~ I hope you find this REAL review helpful! ~~~

title: Would prefer to buy sealed boosters
text:
This is as advertised. You get the "random" Ultra Rares and Rares promised, but the rest appear to be random old Pokemon commons. I highly doubt you'll find anything great in these repacks.
I think your $$ are better spent getting 6 retail boosters. You will get almost as many cards, with many more rares/foils, and likely much better quality. But to each their own... my son still enjoyed them
~~~ I hope you find this REAL review helpful! ~~~

title: Cute set!
text: I ordered these for my 7yo daughter and she was beyond thrilled. These were easy enough for her to do on her own and she had an absolute blast. The paints were bright and colorful too. My only complaint is that the set came tossed all about and was a huge mess inside the box. So I'm not sure I can recommend giving this set as a gift.

title: Hours of fun!
text: Our kids have had an absolute blast running around in the backyard plashing in this sprinkler. It's was a fantastic find.... especially for a neighborhood full of bored kids really a really hot summer day. I liked how the sprinkler was ready to use, right out of the amazon box also. And super simple to hook up too. We would all have to recommend it. This octopus has been a ton of fun and well worth every penny!

title: It's ok
text: I picked this up for my 9yo daughter and she didn't enjoy it anywhere near as much as I expected her too. This project was difficult to do on her own and she found it frustrating. She made half a bracelet and never went back to finish it. We did not have problems with the rubber bands breaking though.

title: Best yet!
text: We're huge Azul fans, and we all think this third edition is the most fun one. This game is more difficult and harder to learn... but the challenge also adds to the fun. We've played several times since picking it up last month. Definitely worth it! This version has earned the full five stars!!!

title: Absolutely adorable!
text:
This set is so cute and colorful, I absolutely adore it. Our youngest does too! It is by far one of his favorite toys. He is truly enthralled by this stacking toy; so I pull it out when I need to 10 unerupted minutes to get the dishes done or some other similar chore. It has kept his attention very well over this last month and I am happy to report the thrill has not worn off.
All the pieces are easy to keep clean too. I simply wash them quickly with a little mild dish soap, by hand; and let them air dry on a towel. My son likes them so much, I will be buying these set for my friends at future baby shower gifts! This set was a unique and excellent find!

title: Very nice set!
text: All of my kids have always loved and were really good at Hidden Picture's by Highlights; which didn't surprise me because both my husband and I have fond memories of the Highlights magazine from our own childhoods. And this set has lived up to our expectations. The game is easy and fun; enough so for our kids to run off and play by themselves. And the book has been great for keeping our kids busy too. I can't recommend this set enough! It was an excellent find.

title: Fantastic Set
text: I don't usually like to comment on the price in my reviews, because a good deal is often subjective. But this set really is a good one. I was at Hobby Lobby last night, and there is no way I would be able to get all of these supplies there for $19! Granted I don't have art project plans to use all of the supplies in this kit... but I am sure my kids will think of something creative to do with them in the future. All of the pieces we received seem like good quality too. If this kit contains a lot of what you're looking for, I would definitely have to recommend it. It was a excellent find.

title: The axolotls are so neat!
text: We ordered this for my 9yo birthday and she was beyond thrilled. She is a huge axolotl fan and a huge lego fan, so this set was the perfect match up for her. She had an absolute blast putting it together. Worth every penny!

title: Really nice!
text: These box bands ended being far more useful than I expected. And they make traveling with your games so much safer. The bands seem high quality and well made. I've had them wrapped around two different games for over a month now, just to test them out. And I am happy to report they have not damage the cardboard. Highly recommended.

title: We love Gordon and his tender!
text:
Like most kids at this age, my 3yo is obsessed with his wooden train set. Absolutely enthralled with it. So he was beyond thrilled when I pulled Gordon out of the Amazon box. Gordon's tender is a really huge hit too.
Plus this Gordon seems well made. His wheels are steady and ride smooth. Plus his magnets are nice and strong! My son has been playing with Gordon daily for over a month now and he has held up really well. No significant paint chipping or damage yet. There isn't one bad thing to say about this him. Gordon would make an excellent present for any wooden train lover. Plus I absolutely love the new, eco-friendly packaging. We'll be back for more wooden Thomas trains, for sure!!!

title: So much fun!
text: Probably like yours, my 3yo is obsessed with his wooden trains. So words can not explain how excited he was when I pulled James out of the Amazon box. And he is really well made too. James' wheels ride smooth; plus his magnets are nice and strong! My son has been playing with James daily for over a month now and he has held up really well. I think that his tender makes him extra special to by son. There isn't one bad thing to say about this James. He would make an excellent present for any wooden train lover. Plus I absolutely love the new, eco-friendly packaging. I'm happy to report he's worth every penny.

title: Neat! Fun STEM project
text:
I usually try to stay to Lego brand bricks, as that is what we have mostly already. But occasionally there are a few models that we find that are off brand. This was enough fun to integrate into our collection.
The instructions were good, the build was very fun to put together, and the finished product is really neat! Reminds me of Johnny 5 from Short Circuit! Super fun little robot
The app controls and programming aren't the best, but they are functional. My kids had no problem figuring it out and making it zoom around the kitchen.
~~~ I hope this REAL review was helpful! ~~~

title: So very exciting!
text:
Words can not even tell you how ex cited my 8yo was when I pulled this egg out of the Amazon box! She was beyond thrilled. And has since spent the last two days playing with this set.
She was able to crack open the egg without needing any help.... and had an absolute blast doing it. Probably the most fun I've seen her have in weeks, truly. It does get a little messy. But the clean up was simple enough, so I would say the mess was more than worth it. We would both have to recommend this adorable blind surprise. It would make an excellent birthday day or holiday gift, too.

title: Fun gift!!!
text: I remember doing several string balloon projects like this when I was little, so I was more than thrilled to create this project with my own 9yo. And we had a blast putting it together. It isn't a kit she could have done by herself, but was able to do most of the steps by herself with a little bit of guidance. It was a fun project and I am happy I found it. Highly recommended kit, for sure.

title: Really nice kit!
text:
I picked this set up for my 9yo and I am really happy that I did. She's had a ton of fun making bracelets for all of her favorite friends and relatives. At first, I sat with her as we opened the kit and figured out the pieces. But she took to the weaving tool really quickly and is able to complete 95% of the bracelets on her own. I only have to help her knot them off at the end.
It's really nice that everything she needed was included in the kit. And all of the pieces seem like good quality too. And the charms were just too adorable; those were her favorite part. She's had a blast, so I would have to say we would both recommend this kit. It would make a fantastic and affordable gift, for sure.
Hope this review was helpful.

title: So much fun!!!
text:
This wand is just too cool. We picked one up a similar one from one of the major theme parks and it is probably the #1 toy my kids fight over the most. So I figured a second one would help squash the fighting. And I am happy to report the one we found here on Amazon has been just as big of a hit. It works just as well too. It is easy to refill and the batteries last forever. My kids are simply obsessed. Just know it doesn't blow big bubbles, but rather tons and tons of smaller bubbles. But we would all still highly recommend this bubble blower. If you're shopping for an unforgettable present, I would have to recommend this!!!
Hope this review was helpful.

title: Absolutely fantastic!
text:
This book is just too adorable. The audio is nice, and not too loud or annoying. And the best part is since we've gotten this, I no longer have to hand over my phone, lol. This book feels solid too. The sound pad is well made and looks like it should last through a couple of kids. The current baby is thrilled with it, and so are we! I would definitely have to recommend picking this little guy up. I also think this would make an excellent, but inexpensive, add-on baby shower gift. It's was a great find!
Hope this review was helpful.

title: Very nice!!!
text: It's crazy how close these smell to peanut butter cups! The markers are juice and the colors are vibrant. But I don't think they are washable, so I only let my older kids use them.  I still think these would be a cute novelty gift for any Recess lover!

title: They're excellent
text: These blocks are just too adorable. They're made out of a nice, thick, plastic that is super durable. And they're easy to clean too. Our son just laughs and laughs when his tower of blocks tumbles over.

title: For girls too!!!
text:
My 8yo was absolutely thrilled when I pulled this creeper costume out of the Amazon bag. She was literally jumping for joy. And it is just to cute on her too. I would say it's true to size and fits her perfectly. Plus, it's bright and colorful; and looks just like it does in the pictures. And this jumper feels well made too. I truly can't think of one bad thing to say about it.
It's not just a "costume" for Halloween either. Every day I have to say to her: "No, you can't wear that to school", lol. So I would have include that I think this would make an excellent, year-round present. Any one of my older kids would have loved to receive something like this for a gift for their birthday's or Xmas. This jumper was a really neat find!

title: Very nice!
text:
I have to say, this plush is pretty adorable. My daughter is a huge fan of AU, so she was thrilled from the moment this came out of the package. That is, once we got it opened and she realized what she had. The thing I didn't love about it is that the plush came super vacuum sealed. Smooshed flat. So inside the packaging, it isn't quite obvious what it was. Meaning the plush doesn't come in the best form to give as a gift. It fluffed back up fine though. And since she loves it, we both would have to recommend it.
Hope this review was helpful

title: Simply too sweet!
text: These are adorable little teethers and our son likes them a lot. They seem well made too. They're bright and colorful, so they seem to keep his attention better than other teethers. Plus these are really easy to clean. This set was an excellent find and we're really happy with them.

title: Another great figure set in the Dungeons line
text:
My son loves Minecraft, but especially Dungeons. We play it a LOT. We have several figures from this line, and they are top notch. They are really well built, and there are a lot of our favorite characters in these sets.
This one is fun, but also check out the others in the Dungeons series, lots to love!
~~ I hope you found this REAL review helpful! ~~

title: Like UNO but faster and easier
text:
This is a matching game, much like Uno. You match by shape/color/number and see who can get rid of their cards fastest. It is a nice alternative to Uno, as play goes much faster, Uno games tend to drag on for awhile.
However, the quality of the cards is an issue, as others have mentioned. They are flimsy, non-coated cards. This is almost unheard of in board/card games these days. Why these cards went out without a stiffer coating is beyond me, very surprised.
~~ I hope you found this REAL review helpful! ~~

title: Least fun version yet
text:
The idea of ALL WILDS sounded good, until we played it. Because there are no suits, basically every card is an action card, so you always have something to play. That means that unless forced by someone else, you never had to draw a card because you didn't have something that you could play. Which means that you just blow through games and who wins is very random, since it is very hard to stop someone who has UNO!
I think we will stick to one of the many other versions we have of this game...
~~ I hope you found this REAL review helpful! ~~

title: Fun building set for Ryan fans!
text:
Generally not a huge fan of off brand building block sets, we usually stick to the "official" brand. However, sometime, like with Ryan's World and Pokemon, if you want the special minifigures or builds that relate to those, you have to take what you can get. That being said, this was a fun build for my daughter, and she LOVES having a Ryan and Combo Panda minifigure sized toy to go with her other Lego minis. The truck was a fun build and provides fun playtime after it is assembled. From what I have seen of the Ryan builds, they are all a bit basic, but fun and provide the unique characters that kids want from Ryan

title: Minecraft AND Nerf!
text:
My kids were SUPER excited when I pulled this out of our Amazon box!
We have a ton of Nerf items already, and the newest one is always the most popular. My kids LOVE Minecraft, so the chance to combine the two was really fun. The blocky design is true to the game, and looks really neat. It is single shot at a time, with a pull back loading action. The only drawback is that it only holds 3 darts, which is a bit cumbersome. Otherwise GREAT for kids cosplay!

title: Fun set in a great line

All of the Minecraft toys from Mattel are fun and true representations from the game.
Add the Archer and the spooky whither to your collection!

title: GREAT set! super fun
text:
My kids love the Pokemon line of building bricks from Mega! They have really committed to the line, and they are all fun and give them a new way to collect them all.
This set has the 3 original starters and also Pikachu! All the builds are fun and well done, and its really cool to get them all in one set. I highly recommend this entire line to all Pokemon fans

title: Tremendous value, nice selection of designs
text:

title: Great for Pokemon! Cute cover picture
text:
My kids have more Pokemon cards that storage space for them. We are always in need of binders.

My son really likes the Pikachu hiding on the front, it is a unique look!

title: SO MUCH FUN
text:
I already had a Otamatone that I was gifted a few years ago. They are really fun, anyone can play it!

title: Adorable
text: These soft blocks are fantastic. Our son  loves to chew on them. But also he just laughs and laughs when we stack them and knock them over. I think these would make a good add-on or inexpensive baby shower gift to.

title: These would make an inexpensive baby shower gift, btw
text:
This set of soft blocks is just too cute. My son simply loves them. They're really good quality and as vibrantly bright in person as pictured above.
His favorite thing to do is stack them.... And to teeth on them too. But my favorite thing about them is how easy these are to keep clean. These blocks were an excellent find. I can't recommend this set of enough since we play with them every day.

Hope this review was helpful.

title: Nostalgic fun!
text: I know I had one of these when I was a baby, and I just barely remember it; so I was beyond thrilled to find one again here on Amazon. This Infantino baby toy is every bit as cool still. It feels well made and didn't come out of the package smelling like strong plastic. Our boy seems quite entertained by it so far too and it keeps his attention well. It's easy to wipe down and keep clean as well. I really like it a lot. So much so, I book-marked this page. This would make an excellent but inexpensive shower gift.

title: Very nice!!!
text:
In an effort to reduce screen time, I've insisted my kids start doing art projects. My 8yo daughter wanted to try diamond painting after seeing her older sister do it and she now she is absolutely loving it. I chose this set in particular for her because it came with a lot of fun different characters that still appeal to a girl her age. And each character wasn't too big either. So she can complete a character in one setting. And this set did not disappoint. She absolutely was thrilled to try all of them.
This set comes with everything she needed too. The materials are nice quality and the gems are bright. I am happy to say she has stuck with them and has already finished five or six. Each have turned out great and she was very proud of her art. Definitely consider this set. You get a lot of bang for your buck.
Hope this review was helpful.

title: These are great!
text:
My 8 & 11yo absolutely love these mega ball construction characters! They were probably their most favorite toy of 2021. These balls really are even cute in person. And the figures stay built after being assembled. They make them so happy, even I want them to "collect them all".

Thank you for reading this review and I hope it helped make your decision easier.

title: Can't be cleaned
text:
Overall, it's an adorable set. But two of the four pieces probably will end up in the trash. These teethers were designed with holes, which means baby spit and soapy water is going to get trapped inside. I've had four kids and so we've had our fair share of baby/toddler toys with small air holes like this, and it never works out. I like to give toys that go in mouths a good cleaning; but they also have to be able to properly and completly dry.

Hope this review was helpful.

title: Buy this now!!!
text:
This kit was made to help families like ours. I am a stay at home mom to four kids (11yo and younger). Prior, I was an artist and earned a Special Ed and a Rehabilitation degree. My background has been useful because we ended up a household full of ADHD, severe anxiety, learning and speech disabilities, plus more. We have been using this set for three weeks now and it has proven invaluable. It truly was an excellent find.

We do not own the original set (with the Dove on the box), but I suspect this new version is probably an upgraded improvement of the first box set. It looks very similar, except now there appears have some new (maybe better) ideas and slightly more guidance in this new version. I don't mean to imply this set is a duplicate of the first set, nor am I trying to discourage you from buying both. I simply don't know. I came to the conclusion that these were similar after reading the reviews for the first one. Had I been given the option to chose between the two sets, I would have chosen to start with the newer set I am reviewing here today. Simply because of the changes that were made.

ABOUT THE PRODUCT:

- Most of the cards appear to have between 200 to 300 words. Each activity lasts about 5 minutes per card, give or take. Of course each could be longer or shorter because you get decide how much time you want to spend.

- This newer set has a total of 24 meditation activity cards. 18 of the 24 are guided scenarios. The 18 cards are "story like, short guided imaginary meditation with different scenes that people can imagine themselves taking a part of. Meaning they ask you to concentrate and imagine yourself in a particular story line (like "walking through the woods" or "stargazing on a warm summer night", for example).
- 6 of those 18 cards mentioned above focus on our senses (touch, taste, etc).
- In addition to the above 18, there are 6 more "positive affirmation" cards. These affirmations address different times of day (morning or bedtime) -or- feelings (anger, stress, etc).

OTHER COMPARISON NOTES:
- From what I can tell, the original set only appears to have 23 guided imaginary "walk through the woods" type scenarios. It does not specifically explore common human experiences that center around feeling or our body.
- The Legend Card is unique to this set. The Legend is more of a guide chart that will help you quickly find the most useful card, depending on the your feelings/needs at the moment.
- Both sets have the same breathing exercise card.

MY POSITIVES:

- This set is excellent quality. The cards are very nice and are made of a thick paperboard. They are technically laminated, though it wouldn't consider it a plastic waterproof type of covering. It feels more like a wax coating that is water resistant. But it is a sturdy material.
-This truly is an activity for all ages. Kids 6 and younger will probably need guidance. Around 6 or 7, this could probably be an independent activity for most kids. But this mediation set is NOT just for kids. I think pre-teens, teens, and even adults can still benefit from these cards. I wish I made more time to use them myself, tbh.
- These have been excellent in helping everyone in our house decompress and cope with our daily stressors.
- I think this encourages and even teaches how to use our imaginations better (an essential skill!!!).
- It has increases our awareness of self worth. And in a sense, these also teach us to take responsibility for some of our thoughts and feelings too. These activities seem to encourage future motivation and action too.
-This kit is secular and inclusive. Meaning it is not religions in any way. And Many people are represented in the images. The language the cards use, and the activities are age and gender neutral. The suggested scenarios are something anyone can envision.
- And the art is beautiful.

THE NEGATIVES:
- The box is terrible. It's too small. It's impossible to find the one card the Ledged Guide tells you to grab without taking out the entire stack. And it's a pain putting the cards away. I'm going to have to come up with a better storage system.
- There are spelling mistakes, improper punctuation, and unnecessary capitalization. If it had been here or there, I wouldn't have said anything. Nor am I in a position to judge. But it's really bad and does not feel educational.
- The price feels a bit steep initially. However, I think if you make it a goal to give this set a real try and use it for a little while, I think you'll see the $30 price tag actually feels like a good deal.

Overall, I definitely recommend trying this. It is unique and I wish I had know about the original set years ago. But I think this newer set was an even better find. We couldn't be happier. Thank you for reading this ridiculously long review and I hope it helped make your decision easier.

title: Fantastic!
text:
My extended family is obsessed with Elf and so I picked this up to play at our family gathering over the holidays. We got to play this several times and it was a blast. I can confidently say everyone had a great time. It was easy to learn and the kids as young as 3+4 could join in.
I have nothing bad to say about this. The game and box were made with nice quality materials. Which is good because I think game just became a new family holiday tradition!

title: Super cute!
text: I ordered this for my 11yo some because his handwriting is terrible and he needs a lot more practice. His teacher suggested journaling and I think that was an excellent idea. This notebook is really cute in person and seems well made. The lock technically works, but it's more for show. It came quickly and arrive safely. I would order this again as a gift, for sure.

title: She loved it
text:
This art kit was an excellent find. My 8-year-old was able to do the butterfly completely independently, even though I did hang out nearby to talk with you some of the steps. Everything your child will needed is included in this kit; and all the pieces feel sturdy and well made. She had a blast and the butterfly turned out cuter another expected. She wanted to do the second flower immediately, lol. I think the "average" 5 or 6yo could do this, but would need help. A 7 or 8yo could do this independently, but may need a little supervision.
Thank you for taking the time to read this review and hope I helped make your decision a little easier.

title: Really nice!
text: This was a really cute set. I ordered them for my 3.5yo, but my 5yo also has had fun putting them together with her. They're not as challenging for him, but they are perfect for her. The puzzles are well made too. They are smaller than the traditional Melissa & Doug wooden ones that come on a tray; but that didn't seem to matter to my little ones.  They're came stacked together and wrapped in shrink wrap. There was no container or case for these; so I store them in gallon ziploc bags. This set was an excellent find and a lot of fun.

title: Lots of fun!
text: This is one of the better science kits we've had so far and I have four kids, the oldest being 13... so we've owned a lot. I'm happy to report my kids have actually wanted to do (almost) all of the experiments and we're blowing through them. I like that the instructions are easy to read and to follow. This set does require that you collect things from around the house (like eggs), but it was stuff we actually had on hand! I haven't had to go out and buy anything yet to finish an experiment, so that is pretty awesome. Overall, we're all really impressed. It's fun and you get a lot of bang for your buck with this kit.

title: This would be a great group gift spanning many ages!
text: I have to say our kids liked this game a lot more than we expected them too. Spongebob is a favorite around here, since this show keeps the attention of all my kids (my youngest at 3 up to my oldest who is 11). So everyone in the family was excited to play this game. It was easy to learn and actually fun. We laugh the entire time. I'd have to say my kids would recommend it since they have been relentlessly asking to play it, lol.

title: Absolutely adorable!
text: This GROW puzzle is a really unique and neat puzzle. My 8 and 11yo were able to put it together without our assistance. It helped that the pieces were rainbow, so the kids could tell approximately where the pieces should go. The puzzle is well made too. The wood is thick and feels durable. Plus the colors are too bright and look really nice in person too. I can't think of one bad thing to write about it. Both my kids like it and were really proud of themselves, so I think this puzzle would make an excellent gift for older kids. It's really cool.

title: Paints will stain!
text:
This set is closer to four stars for me, but I gave it five stars because my kids absolutely love this science kit.
What I liked about it: The instructions are well written and were easy to follow. It is not made with super cheap plastic or ingredients. Most everything you're going to need is included inside the box. And overall, it really engages the kids and keeps their attention. All four of my kids (ages 3 to 11) excitedly hovered around the table the couple of times we pulled this kit out.
What I didn't love about it: I don't like how this kit includes two different types of staining dyes (food coloring and neon acrylic paint), so make sure you're kids are wearing play clothes. On a similar note, I didn't like how they used neon paint as one of the dye options to for the lava flow. It simply doesn't work as well. Nor was there enough neon paint included to both experiment with and to paint the mountains. Also, the neon doesn't glow as bright as pictured... mainly because of the tiny amount of paint and the mini light that's included. The flashlight pen is not bright enough to light up the whole volcano, like it shows. Also one of the suggested side projects are just weird. For example, one requires you to have an "old" wire brush lying around, that you'd have to be willing to cut up? I don't understand why they didn't include all of the supplies the instructions suggest you'll need.
So overy, I think it's a neat kit. My kids have pulled it out three times to use and I suspect they will probably pull it out one more time before it starts collecting dust. I would definitely recommend it if the price is right. I would buy at the $20 post Christmas sale price it is listed for today. At around $30 or more, this set would start to felt pricey to me.
Hope this review was helpful.

title: Just too cute!
text: This jumperoo was a fantastic find. I think it has to be our son's most favorite thing in this house. He would bounce in this for hours if I let him. It's crazy how happy he is in here. The jumperoo had to assemble it, but that didn't take more than ten minutes tops. Plus I like how this one is gender neutral, so I'll be able to reuse it when the next baby that comes along. And because of the grow with me features, I like that this won't be sitting in storage collecting dust. It's really neat that we can use the jumperoo car base as a toy until the next baby gets here. Overall, it's really neat and we all would highly recommend you consider this one!

title: Dollar Store Item
text:
Normally I do not like to comment on the price of an item, because value can be subjective. But I would have felt ripped off had we paid full price for this set of notebooks. They are very small. Trinkets basically. Something I'd expect to find at the Dollar tree. These mini notebooks remind me of something our kids would get in a children's birthday goodie bag or something they'd pull out of a treasure box at the dentist. Plus the orange simply smells bad. I wouldn't purchase these again, so I cannot recommend them.
Thank you for reading this review and I hope my opinion has helped you make your decision easier.

title: Fun fidgets for lots of ages!
text:
My older children have been diagnosed with ADHD, so these balls are a great addition. They do a great job of keeping kids hands busy, no matter their age. Of course our 3yo also enjoys all four be balls. I often toss my kids these when we're watching a movie or sitting around relaxing.
They balls seem durable and very well made. I expect that they will last a long time. This was really great set and I'm happy to have found these! I would rebuy them again, so I would definitely recommend them.

title: Nice case for traveling with your favorite dice
text:
I USED to game with my friends in person all the time, but the pandemic has restricted that.
However, this case is very convenient to store and transport your favorite dice. I have several sets that I enjoy using regularly, and I always had issues transporting a pile of rectangular dice boxes, like the sets of 7 dice usually come in. Either I had to move all the little boxes, or I had to throw them all in a bag where they get mixed up and bashed together. Now I can take my sets, together, in their own padded case.
There is also storage for beads, tokens, etc in the mesh pockets.
My favorite part is the embossed dragon on the lid, and the D20 zipper grips! You need something like this if you have a ton of favorite dice like I do

title: Nice learning puzzle, could be better
text:

I didn't especially like that about 1/2 of this puzzle is the frame/ocean. Also not all of the shapes of the states are true to form. Its close, and I am probably being picky. Lastly, I would have really liked to see them put the state capitals on there to more teachable moments.
The kids still enjoyed it, I just feel like they left some good teachable options on the cutting room floor.

title: Super STEM
text: This turned out to be an excellent group gift! From the moment I opened the Amazon box, all four of my kids where clammering to head outside. They've had it for a couple of weeks and play with it every few days still. The launcher seems durable and is easy enough for even my youngest (3yo) to get the rockets flying. I would buy this again for a friend or their cousins, so I would have to recommend it!

title: I'm torn
text: These v-day planes could have been absolutely great. They're really cute, the value can't be beat and are a excellent alternative to candy. And they fly really great -IF- and only if you put the plastic clip on the nose. My problem with these is instructions aren't included with each plane. They're only printed on the side of the box these planes come in. So I asked six (6!!!) different kids to put each put one together. All six kids were excited by the plane and figured out how to put together this mini puzzle without needing help. But not a single one of them thought to put the plastic clip on the front of the plane. They each threw their planes around a couple of times and then lost interest really quick (because again, the don't work well without the weighted nose part on). So I could see a lot of kids putting these planes together and then ten minutes later a lot of parents throwing them in the trash. And that I think is such a waste, bad for the environment, yada yada. Plus the card itself is boring. It is printed the same on the front and back. So again, these were so close to being perfect. On the positive side, there is enough room to write "put plastic clip on nose" on the card.

title: Really neat!
text: This is a really cool idea! Other then an extra scarf and hat, we rarely have any of the extra accessories to make a real snowman... so my kids were absolutely elated when I pulled this kit out of the Amazon box. Like they really thought this was of the coolest things ever. my 8yo daughter especially. The very first snowfall she went out and built herself a mini snowman. The scarf, nose, and two button eyes have been outside for almost two weeks and are holding up, so I would consider these reusable too! It's a really fun kit for some outdoor fun!!!

title: Cool set!

This ended up being a great gift for older kids (mine range in age from 8 to 13yo). These cubes are made out of a lighter weight plastic, but they seem to be holding up well. And I like that there are more than enough to go around, so there has been a lot less fighting, lol.  These cubes are getting a lot of use too. I have seen every kid playing with them at least once a day. Even the snake and round dot ones, which are more like fidget toys, are still fun to play with. My kids are happy, so I would have to recommend this set!

title: Fun group gift!
text: I gave these to all of my kids for Xmas and two weeks later I can honestly say they have been a huge hit. This was a great gift for my older kids who range in age from 8 to 13yo. They're made out of a lighter weight plastic, but seem to be holding up well. And I like that there are more than enough to go around so there is a lot less fighting, lol.  I have seen just about every kid playing with at least one, once a day.... so I would say they aren't collecting dust. Even the round dot one, which is more of a fidget, is still fun to play with. title: Really cool

title: Very nice!
text: This is a really nice puzzle. It wasn't too hard -or- too easy for my 5-year-old to put together. I think he's a smart cookie, but it did take him a couple of attempts to finish. Which is just fine, because it also taught him a lot of patience. I would definitely recommend you consider this one. This puzzle makes an excellent stem gift.

title: Perfect
text: My husband ordered this from our 8-year-old and she couldn't have been more thrilled. She has rebuilt the set all three ways, but like the lion the best. The 3 n 1 are usually a great value and make excellent presents! This set did as well!!!

title: Worked out great!
text: This ia a fantastic set! Our four kids enjoyed the variety of items that came in this box. The pop calculator was too cute and my favorite part. I like also that quite a few items came in this one box, so there are plenty to go around. None of my kids are fighting over any one thing because there's always something different to fidget with. I recommend you considering this set, for sure! It was an excellent find.

title: Very nice
text: My youngest likes this traveling puzzle book a lot. We don't allow them to have tablets in the car, so this has been a lot of fun and very helpful at keeping her busy. It feels well made too. I would happily come back to buy more.

title: Great easy family game
text:
Another game to add to the game night rotation for my family!
As others have commented already, its a easy to learn storytelling game where you look at a picture and use your imagination to describe it and hopefully get the other players to match. Part Pictionary, part Apples to Apples? My kids are 7 and 10, and they enjoy making up silly stories to go with the art, which is fantastic.
One of the best parts, is that this is a pretty quick game. Around 30 minutes on average, so the kids don't lose interest (big problem for us usually).

title: Introducing the family to more involved games!
text:
My game group is a huge fan of the original 7 Wonders, but it is quite complex and not really kid friendly.
My 7 and 10 year old are starting to get involved in more advanced games, and I have found this one is very nice for bridging that gap. It is far more lightweight that the original, but provides fun, easy to learn gameplay. We liked that there is always a move every turn, even if it feels forced sometimes. No "dead turns"
My family very much enjoyed the satisfaction of flipping the Wonders over and "building" them as we go along. I am trying to educate them on the history behind the Wonders as well.
This feels a lot like the Catan Jr, a way to get younger gamers involved in more complex games, without overwhelming them. This will be in our rotation for quite awhile I think.

title: Battlestar + Arkham = AWESOME
text:
If you ever played the Battlestar Galactica boardgame, you will know how to play Unfathomable. It is basically the original BSG game, reskinned and streamlined in the Arkham Horror universe.
I own both this and BSG, and I am finding we play Unfathomable more. Like the original, a human win is hard, but not impossible. I feel like the humans have more of a chance in this version.

If you HAVEN'T played the BSG game, then you need to know what you are getting into:
- a LONG game (sometimes 3-4 hours) with lots of cooperative play to try to stop the Horrors from wiping you out!
- unless you are one of the "traitors", secretly aligned with the bad guys, to sabotage your friends and keep them from winning.
- there are a lot of rules, but once you have a few games under your belt, there is nothing like it for game day!
As a die-hard gamer, and HUGE fan of the BSG game (Callie forever!!) you can't go wrong here.
~~ I hope this REAL review was helpful! ~~

title: Skydancers remake!
text:
If you had one of the "it" toys in the 90s, the Sky Dancers, this is basically a new and improved version!
My kids enjoy them as much as I used to when I was a kid.
They fly/spin really well, almost too much at times. Watch out for the ceiling fan and the TV!
They can get away from you! Simple to use, lots of fun, as long as you understand you are using a flying toy inside the house.
These are slightly more durable than the old ones, but one of the two we have did crash hard and break off one of the flaps. They are not indestructible
