I like knowing that I can trust the quality because it's made by Mattel. I honestly can't imagine any Cave Club fan not being thrilled to get any one of these dolls as a gift. They are seriously adorable. I highly recommend them!

title: We love Cave Club!!!
text:
Our 6yo loves the Cave Club youtube show! So she was very excited to find out they made these dolls in real life. She's been asking for them all. I can't tell you how excited she was she opened the amazon box.
Now that we've gotten to play with a couple of the dolls in person, I can assure you they are as neat as they are on the show. Their hair and cloths are super fun and funky. And my daughter loves that each doll comes with a ton of accessories. Being an animal lover, her favorite part is the pets that come with each doll. Cats are by far her favorite animal at the moment, so this particular doll was an extra huge hit.
And I think these dolls are a really good value, considering all the accessories that are included. And coming from Mattel, you already know you can trust the quality. I can't imagine any Cave Club fan not being thrilled to get any one of these dolls as a gift. They are seriously adorable. Can't recommend them enough!

title: One very happy kid!
text:
Like so many people right now, our family is huge into Pokemon. So I'm honestly not sure if it was my 9yo or his dad who loved this set more. They sat down this afternoon and had a blast putting this it together. My husband said our son had no problems following the instructions. It was definitely a something he could have done on his own, without help... But it was my husband wanted to be included, lol. Then our son spent the rest of the evening playing with the completed figures. No kidding, he must have said "thank you mom" a hundred times.
I don't think I know a single kid right now who loves Pokie, who wouldn't be thrilled to get this set as a gift. We can't recommend this enough!!!

title: Impressive big!!!
text:
Holy cow, this is huge! The soda can is there for size reference.
It can be hard to grasp the size of toys online. The manufacturer's measurements and pictures are correct, but I was still blown away once it was here. My daughter is going to shriek when gets this!
This surprise bucket is so much more than just a bunch of blind bags. I love that the kids get to make "tea" in an actual cup! And I really appreciate that the larger container cup is interactive as well. Meaning it is actually useful after it is opened. My daughter hasn't let me toss one of those Ryan's egg which are pretty useless onced emptied, so I already know thid jumbo tea cup will be sticking around for years. I'll be back to upload pictures of the contents she gets!!!
I don't know a single elementary aged girl who wouldn't be thrilled to get this ad a present. It's seriously impressive. Can't recommend this enough!!!!

title: So very cute!
text:
My daughter loves this set! She is 6yo and has a few AG dolls already, but the accessories are so expensive. I love that other companies are making compatible toys at an affordable price!
This set came with so many adorable accessories. She's had it for a week now and has played with it almost daily. Loading the cart and pushing it around her room has been her favorite part so far.
It feels really well made too. The cart is nice and sturdy; and everything is made out of a durable plastic (no cheap paper inserts, like menus or shopping lists, that some manufactures count as "accessories"). It was ready to go, right out of the box. Meaning no assembly required.
My daughter and I can't recommend this set enough. The cart alone opens up a whole world of imaginative play, but of course the accessories help a lot. It would be a great gift!!!

title: Excellent gift bag stuffers!!!
text:
I honestly hate giving out candy on the popular holidays. I'm not trying to be that party pooper mom, because I don't think that candy is inherently bad. I really don't. I'm all for candy. It's more because my kids bring home so much from school after each holiday that I end up throwing a ton of it away. More than they could ever eat and I hate waste. So personally, I'd rather spend my money on useful, not sugary "treats" for my kids classmates. These wax art sticks couldn't be more perfect!!!
They really do inspire imagination and creativity. They are colorful and there is more than enough in each package to keep a child entertained for a quite a while. This is honestly one of the better "replacement candy" items in my opinion. I can't recommend these party favors enough for birthdays or holidays!

title: Super cool!!!
text:
We love this line of toys! My husband has tons of vintage transformers, so he loves the concept of this modern version. And of course, our kids are naturally drawn to then too. They doesn't get to play with daddy's collection all that often, so it is so nice to that they have their own now.
Like every other VTech toy, this transforming dino is really high quality. The LED light display and sounds it makes just add to the fun. In your hands, you can tell it's made of thick, durable plastic!
These are so much fun. We highly recommend them!!!!

title: So much fun!
text:
What an adorable craft set! We're heading into fall off 2020, and our kids school are remaining virtual (physically closed) due to Covid. It's been long six months and I'm desperate for new projects. This set was perfect!
Right out of the box, our 6yo was enthralled! The instructions are easy for her to follow and she insisted on doing almost the entire first vase herself. I forgot to look at the clock, but the first vase took her a quite a while to complete. Which was great... it drives me nuts when art kits cost $10+ and your kid is done with in 15 minutes. I also liked that this set was unique and unlike any other art kit we've had in the past.
The first vase she put together turned out really cute. She's super excited to give it to her grandma the next time we see her. My 6yo and I can't recommend this art project enough!!!

title: We're in love!!!
text:
This playset is amazing!!! My 6yo absolutely loves her American girl dolls and accessories; but my husband's wallet does not!!! I'm so happy to see other companies making compatible and affordable AG sets like this!
This playset comes with a decent amount of cute matching accessories! The only thing I wish was it came with a few more hangers. My daughter loves putting away clothes on the bar and in the dresser the most.... and she can fit more than four outfits on the clothes bar.
I considered this set was well made. The quality is on par with Target's "Our Generation" line and I would consider it slightly nicer than Walmart's "My Life". This set would make an excellent birthday or holiday present. Just check the measurements because this is a big playset! Both my 6yo and I would highly recommend it!!!

title: A lot of fun!
text:
This is a really cutest set. You get 5 different butterfly shapes and more than enough paint for to cover them all. There was enough butterflies included in this sef for my two oldest kids to do this twice project twice. My 6yo had the brilliant idea of sprinkling some glitter we had on hand over the wet paint, to make her creation even prettier. She also fun setting up the play mat. The playmat wasn't overly exciting, but it is something unlike other toys we've had in the past.
(Soda can for size reference)

title: Educational and cute!
text:
This is adorable... I picked it up for a 4-year old, but the 6 & 9yo are fighting over it too (everyone loves Peppa on this house!!!)
The character voices and interactive content is really cute. I like that the it has three different volume options, too. And an easy to open battery compartment!!!
(On that same note, it came in easy-to-open and recyclable packaging. It's not a deal breaker, but I always appreciate it when companies make the extra effort. Thanks VTech!)
I can't recommend this enough!!!!

title: BIG hit with little Pokemon fan!
text:
My son has loved putting this together! We do a lot of "building sets" like Mega and Lego, but this is the only line with his favorite, POKEMON!
This set was fun for him to put together, and it is actually fairly big for a building model (6" +).
Great, sturdy build that was easy to follow!
(The built together section I'm holding in my hand is how far he got after one hour. He did mention he wished he had gotten further and said this set "was harder [than other Lego sets] because of all the green")

title: Tons of fun!!!
text:
This is a pretty cute set!
At the time of this review, it's August of 2020 and our schools just announced they wouldn't be reopening this fall (due to Covid). I'm desperately trying to find new activities for the kids to do!
This kit is really good at keeping them entertained for a couple of hours. It comes with more than enough paint and brushes . And I appreciate that there are two of each dino, so my kid didn't fight over them. And the extra bonus stickers are puffy and adorable.
But it lost a star because neither t-rex would stand up on their own. Not a deal breaker though. I would recommend this set!

title: Absolutely adorable!!!
text:
Holy cow is this an adorable kit!
It's Aug of 2020 and our schools just announced that they would remain closed for a while this fall (due to Covid). It's been 5 months of lockdown and I am desperate for some new art and stem entertainment!
So this kit was perfect. My 6yo has never sown before.... but took to this like a fish to water! It was very easy to set her up with and in a few moments she had already gotten the hang of it. The animals are adorable and the perfect size. It's going to take her several hours to complete all four animals, so you really do get your money's worth out of this kit! I can't think of a negative thing to say. I can't recommend it enough!!!!

title: So very cool!
text:
This is so exciting! Our entire family is one big group of gamers and I'm an artist, so this is going to be so much fun. I can't wait to make our own personalized board game!!!!
As intended, the kit itself is very plain, lol. Almost everything here is completely customizable. The cardboard used to make the box and the board is quite thick. I expect it to take an art medium that is low in moisture (like acrylic paint or an alcoholic marker) without buckling much at all. For a novice, I would probably recommend sticking to a more user friendly medium like Sharpie permanent markers (they come in 30 different colors now)! And don't forget, all artists make mistakes. I will make many creating this project; and I plan to cover those mistakes by building up thin layers of white acrylic paint.... Like white out!
I can't think of a single bad thing to say. It's an awesome idea.... And this would make a super unique gift!!!! The possibilities are endless.

title: So much fun!!!!
text:
My son is a long time Disney Cars fans, so I knew Monster Jam would have to bring it... And they certainly did! These are so well detailed and creatively done. They immediately where a huge hit!!!!
And holy cow, I should mention these are huge! They're as big as my hands! So much area for the little ones to grab on to and smash their little hearts out. These trucks are made of a heavy metal and roll nice too. And the double sided poster that was included was well done too. It's printed on a thick board, not cheap rolled up poster paper.
I can't recommend these enough.

title: Love this cute robot!!!
text:
We've had the "Gears, Gears, Gears" and add-on "Gizmos" set for years and they're some out of our kids favorite toys. I knew this robot would be a big hit!
Right out of the box, my kids had no trouble following the instructions and putting him together. They're 6 & 9yo, and it was nice to see them on insist on sharing and putting him together, with one another. And they've each continued to play with him the past few days.
And I love that he's made by Learning Resources. Which means you're buying a good quality, long lasting toy! Also love that this particular robot is real STEM toy that is actually fun as he looks. You can't go wrong with this company. Highly recommend!!!!

title: Now this is a STEM toy!
text:
We had the original Botley on our wishlist for a long time; but the reviews on the 1st version said it had some minor limitions. It looks like the manufacturer listened and made all the right improvements to 2.0!
Our kids are 6 & 9. At the time of this review, our schools just announced they'll remain closed this fall due to Covid. I'm not a great teacher and am desperately looking for STEM activities that are actually fun. And now that he is here, Botley 2.0 really fits the bill!!!
Right out of the package, my 9yo found this almost too easy. Which was great because he was able to supervise his 6yo sister. She didn't need assistance, but more a little encouragement here and there.
They both love video games, so they had Botley's remote down in just a few minutes.
Botley himself is really well built. The plastic feels thick and good quality.... I don't think I'll have to worry about my kids busting him repeatedly running him into the wall. And did I mention that she's adorable!
But leave it to my kids to not use a toy as intended.... They're having a blast setting up Lego towers to knock down or chasing each other's toys down playing "cops and robbers" with the police siren function whaling, among other things.
The only thing both my kids found boring were the extra pieces that came with it. For example, they didn't find the black line puzzle all that impressive and just wanted to go back to playing him with toys they have around the house. Which is great, I love that Botley even revived their interest in old toys (which after 5 months of lockdown, that's incredibly impressive).
There is so much opportunity for creative thinking and learning with him.... We just love Botley 2.0. He's been so much fun!!!!

title: Who doesn't love magic?!?
text:
I think this kit is going to be awesome! It's mid August of 2020 right now, and our schools just announced they'll remain closed this fall because of Covid. Like many parents, I struggled a lot as "the teacher" when they closed last spring and I am now desperate to keep that from happening again. I'm looking for anything to keep us all entertained and excited to learn this fall. This totally fits the bill!! Our kids will be entering 1st and 4th grade and I LOVE that this is something that is age appropriate for both to do at the same time!!!
The kit came complete and the instructions were easy enough to understand. I believe we had everything around the house that didn't come with the kit. I did struggle to find a plain paperclip laying around the house though, lol.
The only thing I have half bad to say about it is the packaging it came in. If you were planning on giving this as a gift to a kid outside of your home, this "looks" very boring in a brown cardboard box. But if I was giving it to my own kids, we'll then I love the eco-friendly packaging. Like normal kids, mine demand to open all things immediately anyway. They can wait an extra 30 seconds to see what excitement comes in the box. My point is, a lot of toys come in both packaging options these days. Just make sure you're purchasing the one that best fits your gift giving needs.

Just like all the other National Geographic toys and science kits we've had over the years, this one is every bit as high quality. Can't recommend National Geographic enough!!!!

title: Pretty sweet!!!!
text:
This is a really cute, giftable set! My daughter anything that lights up, so the lanterns were the perfect project for her.
I liked that this kit comes with three shatter-proof, plastic lanterns! Doing one now and two later gives us time to come up with new ideas. For example, our daughter found some beautiful glitter and little feathers in our massive art bin which she already has set aside for the next fairy jar we construct. I'm excited for her!

title: Water everywhere!!!!
text: It's not shaped like a bug or decked out in pretty colors like some other kid's back yard water sprinklers, but it's performance makes up for it!  This thing is powerful! Not to the point where the streams of water "hurt", but you can certainly feel the pressure when they hit you. This water toy will be an awesome addition to your backyard fun!

title: It's keeping her attention.
text:
Much like a lot of you experienced, our schools have been closed since mid-march due to Covid. It's been 5 months at the time of this review. And we've noticed lately our 6 year old has forgotten alot of her kindergarten sight words. She's also not a huge fan of reading books, as she gets bored easily. So I ordered this game, hoping it would bring the fun back into re-learning old information.
And it really did help! My daughter has excitedly asked to play every night since this game arrived. I also like how the blue tray is just the right size so I can use basic note cards to write out words that are not included (especially as she's learning new words in the future).
At this time, I'm struggling to find anything negative to say about this educational toy! Maybe it would be that it doesn't come with long term storage; but I was able to upcycled the perfect sized container here at home to keep it all together. So really, that wasn't a big problem.
I can't recommend you pick up this game enough!!!

title: Super cool!!!
text:
Wow, so these are awesome! I ordered them for my 9yo who is a fidget-aholic. He has severe ADHD. and he has a fidget in his hands (or feet) for as long as I can remember. They really do keep him out of "trouble". We're serious fidget horders too; we have two overflowing "junk" drawers dedicated just to fidgets... So I'm boggled I've never come across these before.
Anyway, it was our 6yo who fell hardest in love with these magnet fidgets. She's had a firm grip on them for the last three hours, lol. I think they're going to get a lot of use!
The only thing I didn't love about them is the metal gift box came a little dented and some of the chrome appears rubbed off on the magnets themselves. I'm guessing the later happens during the coating process at the factory and it just is how these magnets turn out. The minor infractions are not a deal breaker, especially at this price in my opinion.
I can't recommend these enough!!!

title: This is a blast!!!!
text:
Omg, if I hear "My name is John Cena" and a loud crash one more time, I might just loose it, lol.
My son isn't the only one loving this jumbo toy! Our 6yo daughter is convinced she's a veterinarian and her American Girl puppies and kitties (not to mention many of her dolls) fit perfectly in the back of this ambulance too. I've never seen my kids fight over a toy this much! It has so many uses!!! Can't recommend it enough.

title: Smiles for days
text:
Our 9yo is a huge Minecraft fan and he was so very excited to get this set. He played with it all night long. I can't recommend this enough. This would make an awesome gift!
But also know it comes with one mini figure, that is quite small. Minecraft minis are about the size of a quarter. The other two toys in the set are big, they fill up my son's palm.

title: What an adorable grouping!
text:
Really cute set! My 9yo son loves Minecraft and so he was excited to get these.
If this your first time buying these minis, just know that they are very small! A quarter stands taller than these toys. It's alright though, my kids love any miniture.
I highly recommend this set! It would be the perfect for gift for a Minecraft fan!!!

title: Absolutely get this!!!
text:
Oh boy, I can't tell you how much my children (6 & 9) LOVE this toy!!! Be warned, this doll causes endless giggling!
She's crashed a hundred times already and had held up so far. And believe me, if a toy has a weak spot, my children will find it. And break it. Every time.
Also know th instructions and warnings only look overwhelmimg at first; but in the end were easy enough to navigate and understand. In reality, it's only about a dozen sentences printed in 18 different languages (both in the manual and in the outside). So it only looks like a lot of text at first. It took less than 5 minutes to open her and figure things out.
The only thing I'm not loving so far is the power supply cord. I'm not a fan of any item that comes with its own, uncommon charging device (because if the power supply gets lost or broken, now so is the toy). And it's really short cord, which limited the places around the house we could plug her in to. And as much as my daughter wanted to do it by herself, she was unable to wrap the cord back into it's spot in the bottom of the base.
Beyond the minor cord issues, I can't recommend this toy enough. Don't forget to keep her away from a lit fireplace though, lol.

title: S.T.E.M. for toddlers!!!!
text:
This board is awesome! Our 2yo has played with this for many hours so far! Half the time she uses it more as a fidget toy while she's staring at Elmo on the TV (spinning the wheels, flipping the button). But other times she's intently focused on the parts she can take apart and put back together (like the sliding latch in the middle or the clip on the far right).
She also enjoys bringing the bored over to her dad or I so she can order us to repeatedly untie and retie the laces. It's incredibly interactive!
The wood is very thick and heavy, and it is incredibly well made. Can't recommend this activity bored enough!

title: Good deal!
text: Our oldest loves Ghostbusters, (mostly because of the Lego Dimensions game and the theme song), so this set was a big hit!!!

title: Super cute set!
text:
Our 6yo got the "Made by Me" version last Xmas and it was probably her favorite boxed art kit to date.... And she was equally into this one!
She did 2/3rds the characters in box set in a 45 minute setting. There was plenty of paint left in the tubes (well over half full still). These suction cups stuck to our windows well.
The only thing I would say is the paint is rather opaque, so the glitter sparkles aren't super obvious. But being trapped in the paint, there was no glitter mess (yay!) and clean up was a breeze.

title: No regrets
text:
This two pack was slightly cheaper here on Amazon then in person using a 40%, or 50% coupon at my local brick & mortar store.
Elmers is excellent for slime making and many other crafts. It was a lifesaver during the 2020 lockdown. Besides slime, we made homemade pinatas, glitter art, salt paintings and more with this glue!

title: A decent value
text:
Kinda cheesey. The bottles Ave very light weight and tip over easy..... Add that to the fact the sand settles by the next day, so your left with a bunch of mixed colors at the top.
Kids didn't care though. They still enjoyed it!

title: Something a little different
text: Perfect for our 6yo artist.  She loves my tri-color pencils, but markers more....so these were a hit!

title: Squishy = STICKY!
text:
PROS: It's something our 5 and 9yo can play with together. This toy is about as STEM as it gets. And it has been one of the most played with toys in the 10 days after Xmas.
CONS: The organs are very sticky. Like those rubbery hands that splat against the wall kind of sticky. They organs are already picking up cat hair, glitter, etc. I also agree it is a pain to put back together. I expected the kids to have trouble, but was surprised it was difficult for me (I took a year of anatomy in college and had a similar toy model to this as a child).
CONCLUSION: If I were buying it again, I'd search for one with all hard plastic organs. None of this "squishy" aka: gummy-icky-sticky crap.

title: Pink Tax Warning!!!
text:
Short story: Half the supplies and paint vs the "boys" kits. I will not be purchasing any 4M kits in the future.

Full story: Picked up this Unicorn kit and the matching Dino for $10 each (at a local box store). His kit came with 10 paint colors and 2 packages of plaster - enough for two rounds of dinos. Hers contained half of that; 1 plaster package and 5 colors of the same size. It wasn't a mistake; it's printed in the instructions that the boys kits intentionally come with more! It really sucked having to explain, apologize and then make this right for my daughter. So off to the hardware store, where I spent another $10 on a massive bucket of plaster so she could do it a second time with him.
Had I not had the dino kit to compare, I still would have been disappointed. Maybe given it three stars. $10 for one 15 minute art project is too expensive in my opinion.

title: Adorable but
text: She's cute, but some of the sequins are sewn down along the seams.  Looks odd when flipped, since there is so little sequin surface area to begin with.

title: Meh
text: Overpriced at $22 for the lightning deal.... Don't think I would repurchase after seeing how little comes inside.  Kids enjoyed opening the kit, but have only gone back to play with it once in the last 6 months. My kids prefer to make their own slime from scratch.

title: Poor quality
text: 3 of the 4 ripped within hours

title: Not a good value imo
text: Bought for 5yo b-day. It's cute but she finished it in half an hour. Most expensive art project to date, that is for sure.

title: It's really nice that the menu is made of a thick vinyl
text: Our most played with M&D toy to date.  It's really nice that the menu is made of a thick vinyl.  It lost a star because the "glass" is already cracked after a few months.

title: Lost one star because they are pretty cheaply made Chinese imports
text:
Huge hit!!! - To my husband's displeasure, I hope they bring these back!
Lost one star because they are pretty cheaply made Chinese imports. We kept two wands and sent one home with a friend. I don't know how theirs held up. But of the two we kept, one broke within a day. Duct tape fixed it for a short time, but eventually, the handle fell apart. The other one we kept is still working 10 months later. That poor thing has enduring endless hours of kid abuse. Faught over constantly and dropped a thousand times. And the last one has held up. Batteries last a long time between changes too.
Lost a second star because they are a bit too loud. The sound they make is really annoying. And the LED flashing lights are a bit too bright. The kids might love them, but gosh are these wands are terrible. I can live with them for how happy these make the kids. I still think they're worth it. I even came back to buy more for this summer. Amazon is out of stock, so my husband is the only one happy at the moment. He absolutely hates these wands. He a pretty laid back guy too. Rarely complains. Not usually sensitive to noises and lights. But there is just something about these that irritated him extra bad. I could see them bothering a sensitive family member or the family pets.

title: they're great. But like other's have said
text: For the price, they're great.  But like other's have said, they're not the best quilty. Several have not lasted through more than two uses, (Outside.  In the bath.  I've found them in the car.) ,  it's nice not to have to hunt down extra brushes when it's art time.

title: but pretty
text: Two ripped (one of the split streamers tore right off.... another ripped at the top tab).  Cute, but pretty cheap

title: said happy bRIthday! the I and the R were reversed
text: Spelled wrong!  said happy bRIthday!  the I and the R were reversed... can't fix it, because they're riveted together

title: Too small... feels a little too TEEN ...
text: Too small... feels a little too TEEN MOM-ish to me.  Told my daughter this was the babysitter and she was only here to help.  Then ordered a correct sized vintage mom off that popular auction site

title: THIS vs. GAZILLION
text:
Not an accurate scientific experiment by any means, but we tested both products three times. This product did a better job producing those REALLY BIG BUBBLES, in my opinion. As far as the regular sized bubbles, I felt this mix only had a slight edge of Gazillion... if any.

For me, the cost savings of this DIY mix wasn't as important. It is a nice bonus of course. But I was more concerned about the inconvenience of having to make it and the possibility of me forgetting to make this mix up ahead of time. But because it brings my kids so much joy and I am really happy with this product, I think it will continue to be a pleasure to make this mix for them in the future.

We tested this BubbleThing mix and the pre-made Gazillion bubble solution three times each. We used two wands. The Gazillion "Incredibubble" Wand (one BIG circle, about the size of a dinner plate) -AND- the "Incredibubble Multiple Bubble Wand" (which has dozens of hoops spread like peacock feathers). Both wands incredibly awesome, but they use tons and tons of bubble solution. Like12 oz per outing for just two kids! So Gazillion could add up quickly if your kids are bubbleaholics like mine are.

title: I want more!!!!
text: Green Toys:  Please make a second set before she's too old!!!!  (Maybe in a blue and peach color scheme?!?!?)

title: Didn't last
text:
The two fun ones broke easily and almost immediately.... The yellow one broke within the year. Orange gator was boring and never played with

These were only bathtub toys for us and kept in the bathroom, so not played with daily or for hours on end.

Made of cheap thin plastic. Not durable. For $15, I expected them to last longer. suspect my kids would have had just as much fun playing with a dollar store turkey baster. :-/

title: Think about this....
text: Paying $6 real American dollars for approximately $10 worth of fake coins made in China has got to be one of the most ridiculous things I have seen in quite a while.  Here's an idea, give your kid the real thing!!!  The best part is a real coin retains it's value.  Keep YOUR money in YOUR pocket and don't give it to the 1%!  (Or I suppose in your kid's pocket in this case :-) )

title: Wooden splinters everywhere.... hope you like to vacuum.... A LOT!!!
text:
This puzzle left dozens of little wooden splinters everywhere!!! Literally dozens and dozens.... far too many to pick up by hand. So you'll be left busting out the vacuum every time it is played with. And they hurt! It's a real wooden sliver people, so make sure you get them all! And it wasn't just the first time we opened it either. The slivers were still appearing on the third use.... so I put the puzzle on the top shelf and there it will stay. Probably never to be played with again.
What made me even more mad was on the second time we played with it, I sent the company pictures of the slivers. And got absolutely no response at all. I don't know about you, but that tells me Melissa and Doug are in no way concerned about our children's safety. That's not acceptable to me.

title: Great quality, but their sizing is way off!
text:
Like other moms have said, the "TODDLER" size is truly a size 2T. Their sizing chart says it fits toddlers "35-39" inches tall. I measured him to be 36" on the dot the day we ordered it in mid-September... and when it showed up two days later, it was far to small. Practically cutting into his shoulders and his neck. So glad I sent it back because he grew another inch by Halloween.

So at 37" tall, their size "small" was WAY to big. He wears size 3T in everything right now, so I wouldn't recommend the size small for 3T kids UNLESS you or someone you know can sew! The middle section from the shoulders to crotch was a decent fit, length wise anyway. Everywhere else it was super baggy and there is still a ton of extra fabric around the torso area... which I figured would be ok, because I expected to layer clothes underneath (we're in Wisconsin and Halloween is notoriously cold here). The head gear was a little loose, but an ok fit overall. BUT, I had to have my mom hem up the legs a full 3 inches and stitch two of the spikes down the back together so his tail wasn't dragging on the ground.

We decided to keep the small and not try to find something else because the hubby really wanted him to be dinosaur this year. Overall, I would say the quality of the costume was much better than the similarly priced costumes I saw at Walmart or Target. The material is thinner, but not super thin like most costumes are. It is cuter in person and we got lots and lots of complements even with it being exceptionally baggy. I'll upload a pic so you all can see what a size small looks like on a size 3T boy who is 37" tall and 33ish lbs.

title: They work... but I found an alternative for a $1
text:
Mini hair ties are a $1 at dollar stores (see more info below)

Review:
For use with wooden train sets (Thomas, Maxim, Brio, Melissa and Doug, etc). This actual product does a good job of keeping the pieces together and cuts down toddler frustration. But the bands are thick and hard to manipulate. They're impossible to get back off and equally as impossible for a young child to use. They don't give you the "floating through the air" kind of track support as pictured, but they do a great job of keeping pieces that get bumped out of place easily.

ALTERNATIVE #1: Your local dollar store sells little mini hair ties (for use one little girls hair... they're a little smaller than the size of a dime). I picked up 500 clear bands for a dollar!!!! Sure, I have to twist two or three around instead of one. But I actually prefer them to the Snug Trac because they are easily to twist around the ends, they're easy to take back off and I can layer them on depending on how much support I need.

ALTERNATIVE #2: We also bought the "Suretrack" track supports, which are able to provide the "floating through the air" type track set ups.

So yeah, I'd recommend the dollar store ties and the Suretrack set and NOT these overpriced rubber bands.

title: Made out of the cheapest plastic!!!
text:
We got eight with our original train set and we are down to two in a year because the legs keep breaking off. $13 for a replacement set is a little pricey since they don't last. I'll admit that they DO work rather well. But they are terribly cheap and breakable. I won't be paying this much for a product that doesn't even last a year!

Side note: We are very happy with our Maxim train set. Slightly better quality than Brio or Melissa & Doug, but not as expensive as the real Thomas sets. These risers are the only disappointing factor.

title: AMAZON has this item listed twice at different prices!!!!
text:
I don't have girls, but this is the third time I've bought this gift for a two year old's birthday. I probably keep doing so because I keep hearing that it quickly becomes one of their favorite toys.

But before purchasing, do another price check (by searching "Minnie Mouse Birthday Bowtique"). I know not all the prices are set by amazon... but it was a good reminder that products on amazon can be posted two or more times. See the comments section if you'd like the links.

title: Please beware, AMAZON has this item listed twice at different prices!!!!
text:
I don't have girls, but this is the third time I've bought this gift for a two year old's birthday. I probably do so because I keep being told it quickly becomes one of their favorite toys.

But before purchasing, do another price check (by searching "Minnie Mouse Birthday Bowtique"). I know not all the prices are set by amazon... but it was a good reminder that products on amazon can be posted two or more times. See the responses section if you'd like the links.

title: Pretty good and above average quality for a M&D product
text:
Our son loves this puzzle right now. Even though we've only had it for a week, he has probably put it together a 100 times in that short time.
I've been irritated with the declining quality of the Melissa and Doug (M&D) products in recent years, but this particular puzzle was surprisingly decently made.
However, it is made out of plywood. Which is cheap, so a few splinters had to be sanded off before we let him play with it.

title: Cheaply made and pieces get mixed up in the box
text:
Good idea M&D, but this 4-in-1 puzzle set was poorly executed.
-Plywood splinters throughout. I had to run sandpaper over all the pieces before letting our son play with them
-The divider inside the box does not go all the way to the top, so the piece get all mixed together when closed. Which is frustrating for him. For example, he doesn't understand why the one train piece that got mixed in doesn't fit into is race car puzzle he is working on. For that reason, this puzzle must be played with under supervision.
-individual pieces MUST be stacked laying flat in order to shut the lid... which is hard for a two year old to understand (and is also frustrating)

What is sad, is these problems could have been avoided with a tiny little bit of forethought and product testing.

title: not even an good purchase at 1/2 off the current price
text:
2 or 3 times a year Amazon puts a lot of M&D products on sale... and so I got this for $10.

The blue wheel cutter like thing (looks like a pizza wheel) was worth the $10 all buy itself. Our toddler loves it. Nothing else in the set is worth 2 cents.

Play-Doh plastic roller does a much better job at flattening the dough.

The stamps (square blocks) you see in the picture are the only designs you get.... which is just silly, since like a dice, there are 5 more sides to each block that M&D could have utilized for many more patterns

And don't even get me started on the tiny amount of playdoh that comes with this set. It's pathetic.

title: I'd recommend it based upon how/where you set up your train track
text:
I give it 3 stars based on our experience making it work with our train table and the declining quality of M&D products. This bridge is huge... to big for our set-up. The hill is very high and no matter how you set it up on our standard size train table, the trains come flying down the steep hill and right off the track (which frustrates our 2 year old).

Now if your family set up your train track on the floor and have lots of space to play (along with plenty of strait pieces to slow down the trains before they take a curve) you will probably be much happier with this piece than we are.

The quality is nice but not perfect. It came out of the box with quite a few scratches to artwork. We have a lot of M&D products and I feel their quality control has been lacking in the recent years. While this isn't the worst M&D product I've bought in the past few years, it is on par with their declining products.

And like others, it is slightly frustrating that both ends are female. I understand why they did that and don't fault them for it. But it would have been nice if M&D included a 2" male/male piece with the set, seeing as how it would have only cost them pennies to include with the set. Instead, I had to pay $3 for one tiny little male only piece.

title: Some what fun!!!
text:
Our 24 month old finds this toy slightly boring. Out of the dozen or so ramp like toys we have, this one is probably in the bottom 1/3 of most played with toys. He probably plays with it about twice a day... maybe only 5-10 minutes total through the entire day. I wish it had been designed with a couple of more ramps, and it would have been more fun for him.

But I will say that the loop works very well! It works even better with Hot Wheel cars than the cars that came with it. For that reason alone, it got 4 instead of 3 stars.

title: Perfect for a toddler
text:
Completely awesome first marble run for your toddler! Our son has played with it at least once a day for over a year now. Very thick plastic and durable!

But wow, this particular toddler marble run is expensive here and anywhere else I've seen it!!! But at least it has a good resale value... most resell on ebay for $40ish dollars. So if your willing to re-sell it later on, you won't feel like you flushed $50 dollars down the drain. :-)

Please see my additional comment if you'd like to here my thoughts on upgrading to an older kid marble run.

title: A little pricey, but still awesome!
text:
After shopping around quite a bit, I decided to take the chance on this set and spend the extra $10-15 (when compared to competitors prices on other block sets). Our two year old plays with them all of the time.

VERY glad I did! They are made up of an excellent quality hard wood and are very smooth. I've bought a dozen or so M&D toys this year, and so far have been pretty disappointed in their quality control. So this set was a nice change.

The other nice surprise was that they all fit back in the box. When I first took it out of the amazon cardboard box, my husband said to me "there is no way we are ever getting those blocks back in there". But the size/dimensions of all the pieces were very well thought out and it is surprisingly easy to get them all back in the box in no particular order. So yay, finally got a M&D product worth the over inflated cost :-)

(Also wanted to mention that I got lucky and only paid $35! It was on sale for $40 before xmas with another $5 discount for spending over $30 on a M&D product. Amazon has a M&D sale on about twice a year... and while not everything is included, many of there popular items are. I watch savings blogs on facebook to find these deals)

title: Gosh, I am torn
text:
We have had no problem with any of the tracks staying up. However, this particular add on is fairly unimpressive (especially for the price tag).

I was worried about this particular add on, but soon proven wrong by our 24 month old because he actually remembers to close the trap door after each trip down the ramp.

But still, this add on doesn't do much and is kind of lame.

Also slightly frustrating, the hot wheel car that came with this add-on had a busted wheel and gets stuck on the other wall track ramps we have. Not a huge biggie, because as the Mattel customer service rep pointed out, you don't HAVE to use the cars designed specifically for this set. However, the Wall Track cars are slightly heavier than original hot wheels and do work slightly better on the wall tracks.

However, my overall impression of the wall tracks hasn't been all that great. Our 24 month old played with the wall tracks a ton for the first couple of days. But now, a month after Xmas, I'm pretty sure he hasn't touched his hot wheels set up in over a week. Point being, it is not a long lasting toy.... at least not yet anyway. I'll update this review if it changes in the future.

title: Bought this based on the reviews - and it isn't living up to the 4.5 stars average
text:
I'm disappointed in this workbench. Knowing I would eventually want to get our boy a tool bench, I started shopping for one when he was just when he was a newborn. After carefully reviewing every bench on the market, this seemed like the best one, based on the reviews on several sites.

But here are some of the reasons why I am disappointed:
- The vice (vise) grip no longer opens and closes like in the previous version.
- the nails and screws don't stay up on their own, you put them in the holes and they sink immediately (which completely defeats the purpose of pounding them down with a hammer).
- the batteries are already drained in the saw and drill press, and it hasn't even been out of the box for a month.
- the drill press lights are too bright and flash rapidly... seizure anyone???
- as you'll notice from the other uploaded pictures, the hooks that hang on the tools (like the screw driver, hammer, etc) fall out immediately.
- the storage shelf underneath is incredibly shallow; you really can't store anything of the extra pieces down there. And even the slightest play motion from your toddler will knock everything off of the lower shelf.

So with all that said, it still gets 3 stars because our 24 month old plays with it several times a day.

And another FYI: The last two years, the mega chain store with the bulls-eye logo has put this toy on sale during Black Friday weekend for $40 dollars, so Amazon drops their price too. For $40, it was an ok buy.... but for the $60 dollars it is listed for now (or for the $80 it was listed for in the weeks on Amazon prior to black Friday), I feel like this was completely over-priced. You'd be better off watching craig's list or finding it at a re-sale shop for the equally-as-good used version for around $25-30. In fact, the older used version (where the vice grip is in the front, not on the side) would give you a working vice/vise grip; which I remember playing with a real version in my dad's workshop as a kid and it was a blast!!! (while he supervised of course) :-)

title: Not as awesome once we had one at home
text:
We first found came across the other Melissa and Doug Hide and Seek board at a play date at around 18 or 19 months. He was amazed, so of course I had to get one for him. And silly me, I saved it for Xmas when he was 23 months old. I wish I would have gotten the other version and not the farm one. The farm theme is everywhere (in his books, in his tv shows, and in other toys and puzzles) so I feel like the other board exposed him to different subjects he doesn't see as often.

Also, the magnets are not very durable. At 23 months, we had a bit of a regression and he started putting everything in his mouth again. While I tried to stop it as soon as I saw him doing it, probably less than 30 seconds in his mouth, he was able to chew the drawings right off two the magnets.

While still totally awesome and a great idea, I feel like the excitement of this puzzle was short lived. We've played with traditional wooden puzzles far more often. Maybe I gave it to him too late and possibly would have gotten more use out of it had I bought it when he was around 14-16 months old.

title: Pretty neat so far!!!
text:
These really aren't stickers, but more like vinyl cling-ons. They don't stick all that well... but good enough I think. Many different animals and scenes for your young one to chose from. Great purchase and I feel like they are an amazing value for less then $6 dollars! Highly recommended and I look forward to buying the other M&D reusable sticker pads!!!!

Three small problems:
1) They really do loose their clinginess after a while. But according to the instructions on the back, you can wash them with dish washing soap to revive them. I haven't tried it yet, so I can't say for sure if it works.

2) The other thing is if you leave the stickers stuck on the scene pages (and don't put them back on the white pages they originally come on)they leave an oily looking gray stain on the pictures.

3) In addition, the binding is cheap, so we no longer have a book. Just a bunch of loose pages.

I mention those things because I could see how those big things could bother some kids or some parents. Overall, I still think it is a good value and I would buy it again.

title: Absolute piece of crap
text:
Probably the cheesy gift my two year old got all year. I don't know what his poor grandma paid for it.... but anything over a dollar was too much! Even cheaper than dollar store quality, if that is possible...

The shark attack doesn't work at all! The launch button is so tough that a full grown man can only set it off about half the time... not sure how a kid of any age is supposed to use it properly. The curve down orange ramp breaks on every 3rd use. The shark head doesn't snap close and eat the cars like it is supposed to.

Hot wheels should be ashamed and embarrassed of this toy! I will think twice before buying another hot wheels ramp of any kind. (And before you leave a comment suggesting I return it, grandma took the toy out of the box and and I forgot to grab it before we left. Dumb of me, I know)

title: Going back to the store immediately !!!
text:
Seriously, this marble run is dollar store quality. Cheap, light weight plastic... even the slighted nudge knocks the pieces out of place. Some of the pieces just sit on top of one another, rather than "snap" together like they should.

And unlike the description and the picture on the front of the box, this set does not come with real glass marbles. You get 10 plastic balls that are about half the size of a real marble. They still work of course, but just the fact that they show real marbles being used adds insult to injury.

Not to mention, 45 pieces isn't enough to get creative with. I'd recommend spending slightly more money of a better quality version with more pieces.

title: Personally I think the families are a huge waste of money
text:
The new "Animal Families" are completely unnecessary and a waste of money. All three animal make the same sound. The only difference is each are a different size and a slightly different color shade of one another. Don't waste your money... (that is unless you can get all three for less than $3.50, then you have nothing to lose).

BTW, all of the Zoo Talkers are seriously overpriced at Amazon... $3.50 a piece at the retail stores

title: Love Zoo Talkers, HATE this price
text:
Our Son plays with his Zoo all the time (he is almost two) and we have a ton of animals!

But that is because I paid $2.62 during the F.P sale at Target last week... REGULARLY PRICED UNDER $3.50 and your local big box store!!!

So yeah please don't judge the zoo based on these accessory prices please!

title: Money well spent
text:
These are totally awesome! They save our 20 month old lots of frustration... since he isn't old enough to understand the laws of physics and why his tracks simply won't stay in place :-) They save daddy lots of frustration, since he doesn't have to set the track back up five times a day!

Be warned though, they do not and AREN'T meant to work with every single piece of wooden track (I'm talking about the specialty tracks pieces). They only work on the strait, curved, and the pieces that are meant to go up or down one level.

And there is no need to lock ever piece of train track together. For example, you won't need to buy 100 Sure Track pieces to go with your 100 piece train set. One set of dozen will probably do just fine for most families.

And these are amazing for creating those "floating through the air" type track set ups. Sure Tracks doesn't always eliminated the need for support underneath the track, but since they're holding the actual pieces together, it does allow for more flexibility on where the supports can be placed.

ALSO GO BUY THESE TOO:
Your local dollar store sells little mini hair ties (for use one little girls hair... they're a little smaller than the size of a dime). I picked up 500 clear bands for a dollar!!!! Twist two or three around the "male" end of loose pieces. Makes a world of difference and your track set up will stay together for hours! BTW, I saw the mini hair tie tip after spending $6 "Snug Trac" rubber bands. Total waste of money because the hair ties work better.

So bottom line: Buy this Sure Track set and the hair ties!!!

title: Good quality and lots of fun
text: This is one (of two) of his favorite puzzles.  We have probably 15 (stage one) wooden puzzle; and 5 of those are M&D brand.  Truth be told, he like the magnetic hide and seek board the best.... but I don't know if I would consider that an actual puzzle.

title: Very loud and kind of annoying!
text:
We keep our puzzles in a basket and every time someone walks the sound goes off. Not a big deal during the day.... but during nap time or in the middle of the night (when even one of our cats walks by) I cringe fearing "ribbet, ribbet" is going to wake up our toddler. And as I mentioned in the title, this puzzle is LOUD so you can hear it throughout the house! Also, the kitten piece doesn't sound like a meow at all and the parakeets "squawk" sounds closer to fingernails running down a chalkboard.

I'd be over it if this was one of his favorites. But our son doesn't favor this particular puzzle over any other. The wood puzzle itself is of the same quality you'd expect in a M&D product, so that is the only reason it gets two stars.

Bottom line: Save a couple of bucks and buy the M&D puzzles that don't make noise.

title: Lasted two days :-(
text:
The helicopter was awesome at first. But after the second use it wouldn't charge anymore. Unfortunately we waited too long to open it so we could no longer return it to amazon (LESSON LEARNED!!!).
The only fun part about it was it absolutely amazed and terrified our cats at the same time.... I've never seen them act like that. Still $20 bucks wasted.

text: Our son is only 20 months, so I'll update my review if it changes in the future.  I think all three of the weebles toys I bought him have been a huge waste of money (we have the home, playground and bus).  He pays attention for maybe two minutes tops.  The actual weebles are a little bit more fun to play with and would give them 3 stars.

The batteries lasted only about 6 weeks before dying.... but then again, the poor thing ran probably 2-3 hours a day!  Seriously, BUY THIS!!!!

DOWNSIDE: it only 6 songs... pretty disappointing and annoying being the parent. I'm guessing someday he'll find only 6 songs predictible and boring too.
FOLLOW UP: Still likes it a lot at 21 months old. However, we don't play with it too often because the 6 songs get OLD. Changed it from 5 stars to 4 stars for that reason.

title: Fun toy for $7.50 (amazon sale price); $24 dollars, no way!!!

My 1 year old niece on the other hand simply loves loading them and unloading them into containers (play shopping cart, buckets, etc). But boys and girls play differently... even at 1 years old.
They were a great deal when they were on sale last fall for $7.49; but there is no way I'd pay the full retail price they are listed at right now ($23.99). Not worth it at that price unless you cost is not a factor for your family.

title: So-So
text:
Negatives:
-You will be chasing the balls, if your little one isn't old enough to do it himself (but according to Amazon's opinion of this product, the toy intentionally throws the balls out so your toddler can run around after them)
- INCREDIBLY loud!!!
-once running, the balls are so lightweight, they have a hard time making their way back down the tube (the air blowing the balls out the top also pushes them back up the tube.... however, the weight of several balls in the tube are enough to push them back down the tube past the fan, EXCEPT since the balls are scattered all over your floor... kind of a catch 22
POSITIVES:
+ at 6 months, it made him giggle

Follow up:
At 21 months, he still plays with it once a week or so. While he still enjoys it, just about everything he could fit down the tube has gone into it. Which normally that is ok because I can just turn it and dump whatever out. But things like cardboard get stuck and I had to take a metal clothes hanger to get out. The other problem I have with this toy is that all sorts of balls that are the right size fit (balls from like toys fit in there)... and unfortunately, only the balls that came with the original toy are lightweight enough to work. It frustrates him and he carries it to me often, pouting & wondering why it doesn't work.

title: Right up there with Apples to Apples
text:
We played tonight with a group of 4 and of 7. Was great for both sized groups and we laughed the entire time! Absolutely loved it.
Pros:
1) It's Quick - a round lasts 3-5 minutes; so you can quit anytime, easily add or drop players, etc.
2) Semi-Educational - I learned a new word tonight.
3) Flexible - type of game that you can easily modify the rules to accommodate your groups preferences or needs
4) Not overly competitive - great for groups of varying ages and skill levels

Cons:
1) You'll need extra paper towels for erasing (the four tiny black felt swatches are already to dirty to use again)
2) While the markers are of good quality, they're still dry erase markers and they'll need replacing eventually.
3) Booklets should be wiped completely clean at the end of the night; marker that is left on till next time is really hard to wipe off

title: A challenging game that's easy to teach and fun with 4 people
text: This game is best played with 4 people (two teams of two).  Your partner tries to prompt you to pick the correct cards on the table between you by giving you a single word clue and telling you how many cards on the table it relates to.  You need to decipher the hint by figuring out which of the cards they means, but don't pick the wrong one!  It could end up giving a point to the other team or if you pick the one "black card" on the table it ends the game and you instantly lose.  This game is endlessly creative and challenging as the word cards on the table and which cards correspond to your team will always be different each game.  The creative part is figuring out new ways to bundle the most cards together with a single word so you can find all your teams cards before the other team finds theirs.  It's a race to figure out the code!

title: A classic that still holds up for quick gameplay
text:
I played this when I was a kid and it's still a great game if you only have 30 minutes to spare. In 30 minutes you can easily get in 3-4 rounds of brain busting fun. This game is really about trying to mentally out maneuver your friends by coming up with words starting with whatever letter the die at the beginning of the round gave you that are unique enough to answer the prompt that no one else has thought of it. If no one else thought of your answer you get a point and so on down the prompt card each round. If your answer is the same as someone else's you both cross it out and lose that potential point.

What I love about this game is the creativity in answers and how far you can bend the rules. We always play that the group votes on whether your answer is valid or allowable since it always gets a little fuzzy as the game goes on and our competitive nature picks up. It's a mental gymnastic type of game that is face paced and frustrating but over all lots of fun and laughs with a good group. A real classic that has great replayability.

title: Love this game as a child, my nieces and nephews do too!
text: A great, easy to learn memory  based game for kids.  As you move through the enchanted forest you can look under the trees you pass and each one has an item from a famous fairy tale under it (glass slipper, Rapunzel's hair, etc.).  The stack of cards in the at the castle display one of the fairy tale item and if you know which tree its under you can travel to the castle and collect the card.  My nieces are 5 and 7 and both love playing it.  There are even more advanced rules you can play with that make for more strategic play for older players.  Really cute and easy game to play that encourages memory and is filled with fun fairy tale items the kids know and love.

He brings a smile to my face whenever I glance at him, wildly comical, detailed and well made.

title: Not comfortable for river tubing
text: It's a fine tube and the price for the two pack was right.  But after being on the river for 3-4 hours this was uncomfortable.  The inner hole you sit in wasn't large enough (I'm 6'1") and without a head rest and being the size it is I couldn't rest my head against the tube in any position.  If I tucked my body into the opening and let my butt sag way in I could ride like that for awhile.  Overall, the tube is fine but for riding in for several hours it was uncomfortable and I couldn't find a position that worked, I just swam a lot.

title: One of my top 10 games of all time, I play it often
text:
I love and play strategy board games often at home and with friends. This game is one of my all time favorites and never gets old. The game play requires you to pass your hand of cards to your neighbor after each turn so in you have to constantly be thinking of multiple paths to victory since you can't rely on any guaranteed single route. But this is the joy of the game, it throws you around and doesn't allow you to plan. Your neighbors are attacking you, the card you've been waiting for was just played by someone else, you have to adjust to how you see your opponents playing and try to keep your own civilization moving forward.

This game is dense at the start, it will take you a first play through to understand the mechanics and some of the various paths to victory. It is challenging but after you play it once it slides into place. That's what I love about this game, there are so many (so many!) creative ways to gain the most victory points to win. Every game of this is fresh and new based on how many players you're with and what cards happen to come your way or which civilization you start with. It's at once semi-cooperative but also every person for themselves.

This game is very well designed, it's won multiple awards and has endless replay-ability value. I've taught this to friends who have won it their first time playing. Each round of play works the same way so if you're introducing it to new players they'll begin feeling comfortable with the game play after the first few minutes. It's a lot to explain upfront but once playing a single game goes fast (45 min - 1 hr) so you can get the first round done and move on to a second round where they'll understand it much better.

I love this game, the mechanics are excellent and it's very original and challenging. Up to 7 players is a treat since the game still moves fast with many people and this works beautifully. Even with 3-4 people its still very fun. If you like tabletop games with critical and creative thinking, this is one to get, just challenging enough.

title: It was my 2 year old Niece's FAVORITE Christmas gift this year
text: This is well made and endlessly fun!  My Niece figured it out right away and was loading the balls in the top and SMACKING them through.  That's what makes this toy, the interactive nature of hammering or smacking the balls through the top to start them down the chute.  My niece got a similar Montessori style ball/chute toy for Christmas that was very expensive and pretty but this toy won out.  Great for toddlers, even her older sisters wanted a go with the hammer!

title: I bought this for my niece and kept it for myself
text: Rawry (short for Cordurawry) has become a part of our family.  This stuffed animal is so adorable and personable its hard not to pick him up and carry him around.  He's weighted in his bottom and his legs so he sits up well and his little legs swing about adorably.  His proportions, softness and gaze is just perfect, he's so darn cute!  We've had him for just over 3 years and he's held up to daily play time, he's very well made.  Can't recommend this toy enough, just the best.

title: Sort of an ok bulldozer, not much of a robot

title: My Nephew LOVED it!

The hair swaps were the best part, this can be added to any playmobil set to allow the player to dress up the characters in a range of dresses.

title: Easy to learn, fun for all ages
text:
Most of the time I can't talk my family or friends into playing a game that takes 40 minutes to teach and requires two hours of strategy playing and complicated rules. Balderdash is a fun, easy to pick up game that all ages can understand and enjoy while laughing at some purely absurd answers. It's become one of the main games in our rotation.

Learn the basics in 5 minutes and average game play is about an hour (maybe an hour and a half with 5 or more people). I will say repeatability with this game gets a bit less fun as you learn the tone of the true answer cards (the ones you're trying to detect while supplying your own fake answers to fool your competitors) and can pick them out amongst your friends cards. But overall this game is silly and with some witty friends it is pure comedy, just playing the game can be more fun than winning.

text: Okay I am not a huge fan of the Barbie's made these days.  They feel cheap & having grown up in the '70's I expect a higher quality.  Having said that....I really like this set. title: Not worth the price!!!
text:
Okay, so I lucked out & found this at a discount store locally for $47 & I will brag about this since I know it sells for $94 here & ebay for even more. It was sheer dumb luck finding it. And I am glad I got that price.

I am not impressed with the quality or really lack thereof from Matel these days. It seems these items are getting weaker & weaker but the price goes up & up......

I don't get why I had to put the decals on. Was I saving you that much money from having your factory workers do it? If so, then cut the price since I am doing half the building.

So why give it four stars?
Because my step-daughter is going to lose her mind when she gets this at Christmas. I only pray it doesn't fall apart as I am worried about the weakness I already see.

It's cute. Very creative. The driving seats come out & become the bathroom. There is a small kitchen area in the back. There is a bed which comes with a joke of a blanket & seriously?? two plastic pillows?? What the heck?? I like the couch with the pool slide level. Cute. Creative. And I like the hammock.....but it will only fit small dolls....not the full Barbie. Luckily we have a Chelsea doll & a Skipper doll for that.

Overall, I am not impressed. But a certain seven year old is going to be thrilled & in the end that is what counts.

Again, thrilled I found it locally for $47 brand new in the box. Otherwise......I would really have to rate this lower.

title: Okay, but not Barbie quality
text:
Update --
After leaving my review, the seller contacted me. They were willing to make this purchase right.
For that.....I am changing my mind & giving them 5 stars. GREAT customer service goes a long way!!!
Thank you!!!

Ordered this for part of a Christmas gift for my step-daughter. She is now big on Barbie. I wanted to get her some pretty clothes & shoes.

The shoes were good. Great assortment. All for the dolls with heel feet - not flat. No doubles & all were a good fit on our dolls. Yes, I did test out every pair on all of our dolls!

The clothes are okay. They felt like paper more than dress material. Some dresses were too big, some too small. Out of the 20 dresses we are keeping only 15. 5 have to be thrown out because they don't fit any of our dolls or they are damaged. Mostly the Velcro coming off.

Overall, I am not bothering to return it as I can make use of most of it. I feel like the quality is a bit off. Not really Barbie quality....but you get what you pay for.

My only complaint.....her hair. It was a mess when I got it. Very matted. Had to condition it a few times to get it perfect. But I'm not going to knock any stars off for it since I do love this doll a lot.

title: Very cute!!!
text:

Got it today & I am loving it!! I got three dresses - the one pictured with the red top is cute!! Very stylish. I also got a white dress that is lacey - can pass for a short wedding dress. Also very stylish & cute. There is a floral lace bottom dress which is so pretty! Plus I got a pair of orange colored pants & a green pair of pants. The two tops are also cute....one is white floral with a one shoulder sleeve, the other is a crop top style in a pale blue. The clothes all fit my Farmer Barbie & a random Barbie I grabbed.

The shoes are adorable!!! I received 10 pairs of shoes....all there.
One black pair like stiletto heels
one silver pair for an evening gown
one gold pair for an evening gown
one pink ballet slippers with ties up the leg
one red pair for evening wear
one blue sandal looking heel
one purple pair for a night out
one pink with cute floral pattern on the sides
one baby pink booty looking heel
one blue booty looking heel

Most fit my dolls fine.....not really complaining as I have a variety of dolls. Just wish I had more flat shoes for my Farmer Barbie!

Overall.....good purchase. Planning to order more again. Need clothes & shoes for my step-daughters dolls.

title: Here goes.....
text:
Being a big Barbie fan when I was a kid, I wanted to share this with my step-daughter. She is seven & is now into the Barbie world. She asked for this house over the dream house, so I guess I should feel blessed......

For the money spent, this house is garbage. Not worth it. The furniture is all plastic & the bed is attached to the floor. Sorry, but I guess being a kid of the '70's I remember being able to get fabric furniture & nothing was attached. We could move the stuff around.....

The elevator is cute. I like the way it goes up & down.

I wish there was a floor for the kitchen & living room. To me, it looks a little incomplete.

I know my step-daughter will flip when she sees this.....but I am not loving it. I wish there was more.

Guess they don't make them like they used to!

Next time.....I'll buy on ebay.

title: Muppet fans want this!
text:
First off...I love that the board folds in half & not in quarters! I hate the quarter fold boards. They break apart way too easily!

So I love the Muppets. Loved the show when I was a kid & love that my nieces & nephews love them now. We have been collecting Muppet things & when I saw this game I had to get it.

Monopoly night at my home is a lot of laughs. We enjoy playing whatever version we grab first. And now that we have this one...it's sure to be used a lot!

My one complaint....I wish the tokens had been made bigger. They are a little too small to really appreciate the details in the characters. But I'll get over it.

Otherwise, this game is a must have for any Muppet fan who happens to play Monopoly!

title: Woohoo!
text:
First off, I address this review to all Monopoly fans first....then Pixar fans.

As a Monopoly game, it's perfect. Same rules, money, & set up. This makes for a quick game since you already know all the rules.

For Pixar fans....you will love the pieces! There are six...Mr. Incredible, Lightning McQueen, Buzz Lightyear, Remy, Nemo & Sully with Boo. I would have loved to seen more characters...but I understand the game is only for six people. A few of my friends commented that they would have wanted Woody instead of Buzz...but maybe they could make a Toy Story Monopoly...hmmm...maybe they need to make a version for each movie? Now there's an idea.

The board is good. The properties are things to do with the Pixar movies like A Bug's Life, The Incredibles, Monsters Inc, Toy Story, Toy Story 2, Cars, Ratatouille, & Finding Nemo. I thought they did a good job on it.

Everyone loved the cones & Al's Toy Barn for the houses & hotels. Very clever.

The one con I always have with Monopoly games...not enough money! We kept running out of $100's & $50's the whole night. But you learn to work around it. Or else you bring in money from other games! Guess it pays to be a Monopoly fan & have several editions!

Overall, great game. Still lots of fun & plenty of learning about money & building. But mostly it's a great time with great friends to see who can bankrupt who! And yes, I am evil in this game...but it's all in fun!!

title: Not good...
text:
I love the Monopoly games. Been playing them for years. I do not like this version at all.

Cons -
- only four people can play at once
- you upgrade your piece three times to attain the best value for certain cards
- not enough money in the game, which is normal in most of the Monopoly games
- the money is a bulky piece of cardboard which no one liked
- the cards you put onto the properties before the game starts are in a word, ridiculous
- the board is smaller than the original, only 8 spaces on a side thus throwing normal Monopoly players off when moving....we actually had to count the spaces!

Pros -
- nothing

The four of us that played really did not enjoy the game. The rules are a little different & not at all easy. The fortune cards places on the properties when you start the game are lame & sometimes not really clear.

Overall, I'm sorry I bought this game.

I purchased it locally at a store & wish I could return it....

title: A must have for Tim Burton fans!
text: I have always loved the Monopoly game.  I haven't bought any of the new versions, until now.  I am a huge Tim Burton fan & love 'The Nightmare Before Christmas'.  This is a must have for Burton fans!  The game pieces & board are very well done.  The game is the same, but the new board makes this a whole new game!  Love it.  Glad I bought it.

title: Love it!
text:

I have left this Find It game on my coffee table at home & everyone wants to play with it. Even the kids! I move it around at times, from the coffee table to an end table to atop the entertainment center. Anywhere it goes, people find it & want to play with it.

It's definitely a lot of fun & can be entertaining for kids for hours...even days! Once they find the penny, they will lose interest. Just make sure they go to the Find It games website to register the found penny!

Our son was able to sit on it sturdily and be pushed around even before he was big enough to touch the ground with his toes. title: Excellent wooden unit blocks!
text: I love Melissa and Doug products and buy them often. I was so happy to find that they sell these unit blocks. They did not disappoint! These blocks are so versatile for children at many ages and stages and are fun to use with other toys, like little people, cars, dolls etc. The quality is excellent. The amount of blocks included is good and they can be combined with other size blocks or you could purchase 2 sets for larger block structures.

title: I like to have little toys to keep him occupied when ...
text: I bought these for my great-grandson.  He is 2 1/2 .  I like to have little toys to keep him occupied when he is here at my home.  I saw these animal's on Amazon.  The price was right so I ordered them.  My Great Grandson LOVES THESE ANIMALS.  They fit into his little hand and if he doesn't recognize one from the books he has he will ask "what's this".  Thank you for creating these adorable little toys.

title: Grandson loves it!
text:
Just wanted to review this item. My 3 year old grandson is crazy about trucks and tractors. His birthday was in May and this is still a favorite. He has learned to use the manual screw driver correctly and can take the screws out and in with it. He doesn't use the battery driver as he finds it easier to just use the manual one. This has really taught him about the direction for off and on.
Cons: you have to take off the bottom of the car to plug it into the charger. Wish I could purchase some extra screws.
Update: the customer service is amazing! I contacted them to get extra screws and they really came through! This continues to be my grandson's favorite. He can now disassemble and assemble a variety of trucks on his own and has really taught him how screws work and he's not even 4 yet.

title: A toy with many features
text: Can't say enough about this little toy. It teaches cause/effect, color identification, and eye/hand coordination. Sometimes our grandson played with the hammer, sometimes he played only music, and he figured out how to push the balls through with just his hand. He's not quite a year yet, so he will grow into using the hammer to pound the balls and match the color of ball with the right colored slot. It is a joy to have so many features in something that is not electronic! We supervised him to make sure the balls didn't go into his mouth.

title: Nicely made and all the pieces fit together well
text: Nicely made and all the pieces fit together well.  This is the third tea set I have purchased for my granddaughter in the past two years, and this is the first set where the lid on the teapot doesn't fall off when tea is poured.  For that fact alone, I gave it five stars because so many sets do not have parts that fit together well.  The colors are soft and work well together.  The tea pot is a totally universal item because of its shape and size.  It can double as a soup, ice cream, or cereal bowl from which a child can sip liquid through the pour spout.  Great fun--also an excellent tub toy.

title: My 3 yo loves it
text:
I purchased ours at toys r us for $99.00 and I've noticed it's running about that price everywhere else beside amazon so look around. My 3 yo loves this especially the camera and the drawing ap. I bought a dora game to go with it and it came with 1 or 2 other aps. I wish the downloadable aps were cheaper. And yes, rechargable batteries would make it at 5 star product.

I had no problem connecting it to my computer and downloading stuff but it's very slow.

We've had it a couple weeks now and it's withstood several drops and goey fingers and so far so good. My daughter also has a DS lite and this is much more suitable to her age. Most of the games for the ds are a little above her so this fills the in between years well. I would recommend the leappad.

Now, if you're an adult you'll find there is lag time when pushing an ap and the camera quality isn't that good but it's a toy not an ipad or iphone.

title: Please, don't waste your money
text: Like other reviewers I had this game as a child. Yes, it was plastic as it is now but it is NOT constructed well now! The plastic is very flimsy, the balls are so light weight all they do is bounce, the necks of the hippos are always getting stuck out or the hippos are falling off, the mouth part sticks in the up position, the balls do not go into the "stomach" of the hippo but stay in the neck area and pop out when the mouth is opened. HUGE waste of money but once my 3 yr old opened it she loved it. Wish I could find the old version at a garage sale or something as this one probably wont last a month.

text:

This time we approached the puzzle a little differently: usually we do the border first. This time we put all the stamps together and then the border was last. Many more clues about where the border goes after the middle is done.

title: Quality puzzle!!!
text:
I didn't even buy this puzzle on Amazon, but I just finished it and had to review it. The cashier at the store said it was one of the hardest puzzles she's ever done. It didn't take me very long to piece it together, but it was very entertaining matching all the different colors and letters together. I don't enjoy puzzles that have so much of the same color that I lose my mind trying to put it together.
The puzzle pieces for mine fit together perfectly and very snug. In fact, that is the pro and the con of this puzzle. After I was finished, I was able to pick the entire thing up. I could've hung it on the wall without any glue whatsoever. When placing it back into the box, I had to literally disconnect every single piece because shaking it and bending it did not work. I didn't mind though. I look forward to doing this one again one of these days, and purchasing the "flowers of the USA" one at a later time.
